Business Intelligence-Data Analyst

Who is Credible?

We believe life's changes create financial needs for people and that the traditional financial system often puts up unnecessary obstacles. People celebrate major milestones like going to college, getting married, and buying a home. And most of the time, these milestones come with financial implications.

At Credible, we have built a company with the mission of bringing transparency, choice, simple processes and savings to accessing credit for life's important moments. What you see is what you get. We are committed to being upfront, honest, and clear about your options. There are no mysteries, no hidden fees, and no secret clauses.

Credible is a fast-growing Fintech company that has world class management, has raised multiple rounds of funding, is generating significant revenue and is disrupting the lending market and helping people save money and get out of debt faster.

About the role

Our Business Intelligence team is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst who is passionate about data, analytics, and business strategy. You will help the team learn more about our business, teach others in the company about analytics, and improve the use of our data. You'll be an integral part of providing data-driven insights that inform significant company decisions.

You Will:
Partner with teams across the organization to understand their analytics needs and create dashboards and reporting that allow them to execute more effectively
Work with business leaders to define key metrics and build reporting to monitor and understand performance along those metrics
Conduct in-depth data analyses that lead to actionable insights, owning the entire process from ideation to execution to presentation of findings to stakeholders
Develop data models in our data warehouse that enable performant, intuitive analysis
Build data pipelines and python-based ETL tools for getting, processing, and delivering data
Become an expert on all aspects of Credible's data and analytics infrastructure
Be the driving force behind the adoption and effective use of our BI tool within every team at Credible
Education and Experience:
BA/BS in a quantitative field
1-2 years of work experience as a data analyst, data engineer, or in a highly analytical role
Proficiency in writing SQL queries and using a BI tool
Experience using the command line and git
Strong grasp of statistics and experience conducting rigorous data analyses
Experience with a scripting language (preferably Python) for data processing and analysis a plus
Experience developing models and visualizations in Looker a plus
Experience at an e-commerce or fintech company a plus
Proficiency in Excel and and a strong familiarity with advanced functions
Education and Experience:
The capacity to juggle multiple priorities effectively within a fast-paced environment is critical
You're a highly motivated self-starter with the ability to work efficiently with minimal supervision.
Anticipate business needs and think with a business owner mindset – think critically about analyses, don't just complete them
Passion for spreading the value of data throughout the company and communicating insights to a broad audience with varying levels of technical expertise
Why work at Credible:
We are a fast moving, fun-loving, seriously smart group of people who really care about impacting the lives of our customers. We empower our employees to make decisions, take risks, drive our business and make changes when we don't get it right. These are our values:

Exceed Customer Expectations: We provide an exceptional experience to each and every customer that compels them to share it with others.
Take Ownership: We are trusted to make decisions that are in the best interests of our customers and our business. We think and act like owners. We care – and that makes all the difference.
Be Curious: We are curious, ask questions, seek to understand and try new things.
Do the Right Thing: We earn trust by being transparent, respectful and honest with each person with whom we interact.
Get Results: Results fuel our excitement and we know how our personal accomplishments tie to the success of the company
Be Bold: We are courageous and take risks that scare us. Our enthusiasm for experimenting is how we will find the next breakthrough.
Our benefits: We offer competitive compensation, generous benefits, free food and a flexible vacation policy.

But mainly, you want to work at Credible because you believe in our mission and want to have a major role in delivering on it! We look forward to getting to know you.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

ABOUT US

CredSimple ( https://www.credsimple.com/ ) is a New York-based startup laser-focused on improving healthcare infrastructure with revolutionary technology.Instead of conducting a series of manual steps built on tedious data-entry, our platform automates the credentialing process and streamlines it from a three-month period to a matter of days. We're in it to have a profound, long-term impact and fundamentally change the way this critical part of the U.S. healthcare system works.

Mission
-------

The mission of a data analyst @ CredSimple is to create and productize actionable insights from our data for both our clients and our internal teams. Develop strong relationships across the product, engineering, operations, and client success teams in order to deeply understand the data and the needs of our internal and external clients.

Outcomes
--------

Support internal reporting and Business Intelligence needs
In the first six months, eliminate all manual reporting that the Client Success team does. Replace with automated professional reports that are user-friend and action-oriented data.
Find opportunities based on client requests for new data and analytics-driven products.
Standardize the library of internal operational reports into always-on dashboards that give insights on usage, trends, as well as areas the company needs to improve. These reports should provide actionable intelligence and create a narrative with data.
Forecasting and modeling - Generate forecasting models using baseline data and adjust over time to enhance precision and predictive capabilities.
Optimization - Use our workflow data to find opportunities for process optimization. Identify parts of our workflow that take too long, or could be faster if sequenced differently.
Early warning system - Build dashboards and/or analyses that flag anomalies and leading indicators of problems.
Collecting data and setting up infrastructure:
Ensure that data from disparate sources is gathered, organized, and maintained for ongoing reporting. This will require working with engineering to enhance our approach to data collection and organization. Develop routines that can be automated and easily modified to streamline the process of gathering, cleaning, and making data actionable/reusable for multiple purposes.
Behavioral Competencies
-----------------------

Cross-team collaboration: Collaborate across teams including engineering, sales, finance, and client success to provide reporting and/or gather information required for analysis.
Ownership of the outcomes: Help ensure we're asking the right question before setting off to find the answer. Not just order taking.
Curiosity and drive: Demonstrate curiosity and a well-developed drive to find answers to questions
Strategic thinking: Develop a vision to extend/improve our existing analytics and reporting infrastructure
Qualifications
--------------

4+ years experience in a similar Data Analyst role.
Experience building reports and dashboards backed by Postgres SQL databases.
Expert knowledge in Tableau.
Expert SQL query skills.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to develop actionable insights from raw data.

Overview
The Data Analyst is a new position in NADAP's CareerCompass Program. If you are looking to work closely with the management team of a Career Assessment and Workforce program to shape procedures through data analytics and improve processes to help program operations more efficiently connect individuals to goal setting and career opportunities, this may be just for you!
CareerCompass provides orientation, comprehensive and individual employability assessments and service coordination for adults 25 years of age and older. It is one component in HRA’s initiative to address the unique needs of improving employment and training outcomes in NYC. As the first step in HRA’s programming, CareerCompass will identify and connect individuals to education, training and/or employment..
The Data Analyst position is an exciting opportunity to support the CareerCompass program by conducting data reporting, analysis, and quality assurance using various systems. The Data Analyst is vital in helping the program meet goals and performance milestones, while looking at both clients and staff trends.

The Data Analyst will analyze large datasets and provide reports on a wide range of subjects. The Data Analyst will also handle queries and present their findings to audiences.
The Data Analyst will have strong analytical skills, with the ability to collect, organize, and analyze significant amounts of information with accuracy. They will be knowledgeable in descriptive and predictive statistics, including regression and bell curve. A member of the program management team, this position is vital in the success of the program and in meeting goals established by the funding source.

About the job
Help serve Google's worldwide user base of more than a billion people. Product Analysts provide quantitative support, market understanding and a strategic perspective to our partners throughout the organization. As a data-loving member of the team, you serve as an analytics expert for your partners, using numbers to help them make better decisions. You will weave stories with meaningful insight from data. You'll make critical recommendations for your fellow Googlers in Engineering and Product Management. As a self-starter, you relish tallying up the numbers one minute and communicating your findings to a team leader the next.
Google AI aims to use machine learning (ML) and other tools to improve healthcare. We work closely with partners to research and explore solutions that improve the availability and accuracy of medical services.

As a Data Analyst you'll analyze rich structured and unstructured healthcare datasets. You'll serve as an analytics expert, ensure data quality, build ML models, and deliver meaningful insights through data. You'll make critical recommendations for your fellow Googlers in Engineering and Product Management.

Our team combines experts in medicine, machine learning, engineering, statistics and more to support clinical breakthroughs using a variety of techniques. Our work spans from many projects, including medical image diagnosis, medical event predictions, automatic speech recognition and more. We’ve partnered with medical researchers, bioinformaticians, and healthcare partners to explore how machine learning combined with clinical expertise could improve patient outcomes. We regularly publish in leading industry journals.
Responsibilities
Work with large, complex datasets to solve difficult, non-routine analysis problems.
Design automation tools for data cleaning, validation and verification.
Define data quality metrics and automated reports to provide insight at scale.
Summarize data to draw insights or answer business questions.
Apply statistical methods to measure data quality and detect data anomaly.

Decision Science Data Analyst
Description:
Digital Matrix Systems (DMS) is looking for a team member to add to our Decision Science team. The ideal candidate is a novice data analyst and will become an expert in several DMS proprietary software tools used for processing credit bureau data. Initially, you will train with DMS subject matter experts to become proficient in the following DMS proprietary tools: CreditAnalyst and CreditToolkit. You will use CreditAnalyst to create custom XML scripts that generate attributes on credit bureau data for client consumption. As part of your job, you will use CreditToolkit to process raw credit bureau data to generate client archives for standard and custom attribute sets. You will assist in testing new releases of CreditToolkit to ensure calculations on various bureau formats are correct. As your proficiency with DMS’s tools grows, there will be opportunity to work on broader, more complex projects.

You are expected to have strong communication and interpersonal skills, high motivation, the capability to meet deadlines, the ability to learn quickly and must be a self-starter. Your daily tasks will include working directly with clients, creating short SAS, Python or C# data processing programs to assist in deliverables, collaboration with cross-functional teams, and learning credit bureau formats and DMSXML data structure. You enjoy working with project teams and acting as a subject matter expert.

Qualifications:
Ability and drive to learn CreditAnalyst and CreditToolkit products
Capability to create technical documentation and collaborate openly and effectively with a range of stakeholders
Experience of programming languages such as SQL, Python, R, C# or SAS
Working knowledge of Microsoft Visio
1+ years of data analyst experience, banking and credit bureau knowledge a plus
Bachelor’s degree in Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related disciplines preferred
Why Join Our Team
Our employees are carefully selected, highly valued, and integral to our continued success. We offer:
Competitive compensations and benefits package including tuition assistance, company paid disability and life insurance
Generous PTO and company paid holidays
The average tenure of a DMS employee is over 9 years, we think this speaks to our employee experience
Location: Addison, TX (we love seeing our employees in the office every day)
Employment Type: Full-Time, Exempt
Work Authorization: Candidates must be eligible to work in the US for full-time employment without restrictions; we cannot offer sponsorship at this time.
Recruiters: We love recruiters, that’s why we hired our own. If we need help, we will reach out.

If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or recruiting process, please contact us and we will be happy to help.

ABOUT THE COMPANY
WARE2GO is a technology company backed by UPS that connects merchants seeking warehousing and fulfillment with 3PLs and warehouse operators whose capabilities match their needs. For merchants, we enable easy access to a turnkey nationwide fulfillment network of independent warehouses via a single portal that embeds inventory and order management. For 3PLs, we enable one-stop demand acquisition and no-integration customer onboarding via an intuitive, end-to-end, cloud-based warehouse management system. Standardized and simplified terms, operating procedures, and pricing replace long negotiations, complex set up processes, and lengthy contract commitments, enabling both merchants and 3PLs to quickly set up and flexibly scale on the platform. Ultimately, we help merchants deliver goods to their customers faster, and help 3PLs grow their customer base and monetize excess capacity.
The Job Purpose
We are looking for an energetic and results driven team member to help analyze, grow and manage the supply side of the W2G business which includes 3rd party logistics companies and transportation providers.
The role will involve defining new data that the business should be collecting, devising processes to extract this data, and analyzing the data to gain actionable business insights for analytics and reporting. The data scientist must constantly stay on top of new business and technological trends in order to provide forward-thinking solutions to the business. The new team member will be asked to collaborate with other members across the W2G organization including product and sales and marketing to assist with analytics and reporting and drive development of new features and capabilities.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Strategy Execution & Implementation
Design, implement, and evaluate statistical models and approaches in order to solve business’s complex issues.
Predict and model end-user behavior using advanced analytical and visualization techniques
Extract and analyze large datasets quickly and effectively, prepare reports and presentations to provide actionable recommendations for the leadership team
Apply proper data cleansing techniques and approaches, must be comfortable working with unstructured data with little guidance and direction.
Work closely with other data analytics team, data engineers, product managers, and other informatics analysts across the business to solve complex business issues together
Take initiative to experiment with various technologies and tools, always ready to adopt new data science approaches that provide the best outcome for the business.
Track KPIs and report on the operations network’s performance

REQUIREMENTS:
1+ years of experience working with business analysis/informatics
Analytical mind, with strong skillset and experience in data mining, analysis and reporting
Passion to do whatever it takes to solve complex problems and build scalable processes
Be entrepreneurial, curious, creative, and have a track record for thinking innovatively
Comfort working in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment
Experience working in probability and statistics, time-series analysis, statistical significance, correlation, etc.
Experience with SQL and data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, Domo, etc.
Have excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
NICE TO HAVE:
2-5 years of experience in BI/BA environment
Additional experience working at a high growth startup / tech company
Familiarity with supply chain and logistics processes (e.g. warehouse management, transportation management, eCommerce logistics)
MBA or advanced degree
Knowledge of R, Python, or statistical tool like SPSS
Exposure to predictive statistical models, segmentation analysis, customer profiling, association, machine learning.

SUMMARY
Develop medium to highly complex logical database designs, logical data models and relational data definitions in support of corporate and customer information systems requirements. Work closely with customers, vendors, business analysts and application development project teams to resolve information flow and content issues. Work on enterprise-wide complex projects/issues/enhancements as a team member or lead.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
· Participate in the development of short and long-term information architecture strategies, support and participate in the strategic planning process. Build data migration strategies.
· Provide support for master data management (MDM) system development, implementation and maintenance. Participate in establishing governance for metadata management across the enterprise. Develop metadata integrity processes. Participate in the governance activities associated with ensuring compliance with the enterprise information/data architecture. Work with IT teams to ensure compliance. Perform regular audits of data.
· Work with business and vendor partners, and project delivery leads to determine business data intelligence needs. Interpret and document the data needs for the business. Analyze program needs and translate them into data warehousing and data mart requirements.
· Work in partnership with data architects to design the common customer view of information. Create and implement detailed specifications for metadata repository solutions. Manage the data dictionary. Define, document, and maintain all data definitions, data sources, business meaning and usage of information. Develop single source data strategy. Research internal and external data sources for new data and better sources of data feeds. Identify and validate opportunities to share/reuse existing data/information. Direct the production of regular reports and analysis on data.
· Create a framework for representing the data elements including the entities, relationships and attributes. Recognize and resolve conflicts between models, ensuring that data models are consistent with the enterprise model (e.g., entity names, relationships and definitions). Support the effort for high level modeling of key program processes and key data entities. Ensure integration of the project logical data model into the enterprise conceptual data model and that physical models align with the logical data model.
· Develop solutions and recommendations for improving data integrity issues. Analyze data issues and works with development teams for problem resolutions. Identify problematic areas and conduct research to determine the best course of action to correct the data, identify, analyze and interpret trends and patterns in complex datasets.
· Research and resolve business-critical production problems/system abends.
· Establish data profiling and preventative procedures to improve data quality. Create data quality metrics for identifying data related issues. Collaborate with multiple teams to establish appropriate data access management.
· Ensure technical documentation is developed and maintained.
· Function as an effective liaison between numerous stakeholders to achieve complex tasks and projects. Effectively communicate highly technical and complex topics in an easy, straight-forward manner.
· Assist in the coaching and training of customers in the use of business intelligence tools to enhance business decision-making capability. Work with project teams to understand the business environment in order to manage enterprise-wide information/data support systems. Provide guidance on complex issues to other team members.
· Provide leadership, coaching and mentoring to team members. Provide performance feedback to managers, as needed.
EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE
· Bachelor’s degree in related field preferred.
· Experience in Healthcare domain is highly preferred.
· Seven (7) years IT work experience with five (5) years in quality assurance and/or data management required.
· Expertise with data quality tools for data profiling, cleansing and standardization preferred.
· Experience in implementing solutions and processes for master data and hierarchy synchronizations preferred.
· Candidates must have strong SQL skills and background
· Candidates must have solid Healthcare experience
OTHER SKILLS AND ABILITIES
o Must have a solid understanding of logical database design principles.
o Understand the methodologies and technologies that depict the flow of data within and between technology systems and business functions/operations.
o Analytical thinking; accuracy and attention to detail skills.
o Written and verbal communication skills; interpersonal skills.
o Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with team members.
o Other related skills and/or abilities may be required to perform this job.

NOW HIRING: Data Analyst Position
The Data Analyst will extract, manage, manipulate, and analyze data for FCPH programs and services. Organizes, interprets, and presents data to key stakeholders and the general public. Kargo is the leader in mobile brand advertising. Bringing together creativity, technology and quality, Kargo empowers advertisers to break convention and build connections with consumers on the most important screen today – the phone. Through Kargo's high-end editorial alliance of world-class publisher partners, as well as its proprietary advertising automation tools and award-winning creative studio, brands and agencies have the ability to reach 100% of smartphone users in the United States with memorable, measurable mobile ad experiences. Kargo and Kargo leadership are regularly recognized for the company's growth and achievements, including: Adweek Mobile Innovator (2017), Business Insider's "Hottest Pre-IPO Ad-Tech Startups" list (2015 and 2016), the Crain's New York Business Fast 50 list (2015 and 2016), the Deloitte Technology Fast 500 award (2016), the EY Entrepreneur of the Year NY award (2016), Great Place to Work (2017), Top 25 Workplaces in NYC (2017), and the Inc. 5000 list (2015, 2016 & 2017). Kargo employs 175 people in New York, Chicago, Dallas, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Auckland and Sydney.

For more information, visit Kargo at www.kargo.com or follow Kargo on Instagram (@kargomobile), Twitter (@kargo) and LinkedIn (Kargo).
The Role:
Kargo is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst Intern! The selected intern will work within Kargo's Business Intelligence & Pricing group that aims to maximize revenue and efficiently execute business functions through the delivery of data dashboards and pricing analytics. Kargo is organized into several key departments, each acting as crucial components to drive business.
The ideal intern will be comfortable working in large ambiguous data sets. Being able to view what information each respective department needs to succeed is critical to the success of the Business Intelligence & Pricing team. No prior experience with Business Intelligence tools is required to be successful in this role, but learning them should be of great interest. A STEM background with some experience (and interest) in data science and/or statistical analysis is critical.
The summer program runs for 10 weeks from June to August and all internship positions are paid.
What You'll Do:
Using Looker, Kargo's primary BI tool to construct insightful and easily to understand dashboards.
Work with Sales, Account Management, Finance and Engineering professionals to assess what data needs respective teams and departments might face.
View dashboarding creation through a lens that values automation.
What You'll Learn:
Big data experience. Kargo owns an impressive amount of data. The selected intern will get hands on experience dealing with enormous data sets that they will help aggregate to dashboards that deliver useful insights and answers to employees on the fly.
Ad tech experience. Ad tech is one of the most complicated industries in existence. You'll work with sharp ad tech professionals that will take their time in educating you on the ad tech business ecosystem, where Kargo sits within it, and also how we use our data to make money.
Looker, Google's most recent BI-related acquisition, is Kargo's tool of choice for dashboarding. You'll learn the ins and outs of the tool and become a true expert regarding BI solutions in complex organizations.
The Requirements:
Working towards or have recently earned a Bachelor's degree in a related field (Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or STEM majors)
A "roll up your sleeves" mentality.
A "can do" attitude that believes that anything is possible with the right attitude.
Someone that isn't afraid to think "inside the box" but flourishes in environments that require "outside of the box" thinking.
Moderate experience with SQL and/or data analysis, spreadsheets (Google Sheets/Excel).
Available to work in New York City up to 40 hours a week from June 15, 2020 - August 21, 2020.

Job Overview
We are looking for a Sr. Data Analyst to join our Digital Experience Analytics team. Our team is primarily responsible for the sustainment of our Adobe Analytics instance and the data that feeds from the clickstream data into our eCommerce Reporting Datamart (called eDatamart) for att.com.
The successful candidate will play a critical role on the team by acting as a SME (subject-matter-expert) and “Go To” person to support business clients, internal team members, and application development teams. This “Expert” will need to be adept at performing on multiple, concurrent projects with frequent interruptions and delivering to shifting timelines. Additionally, this person should be capable of researching concepts using external sites, driving closure on projects and issues, and working independently in a fast-paced environment.
The ideal candidate should be comfortable designing solutions to solve complex integrated reporting issues utilizing very large data sets in a highly available environment. They must also be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams to create solutions that will be usable across many organizations.
This position would be best suited to an individual that has a passion for data and analytics. It requires critical thinking, logic, organization, self-motivation and attention to detail.
Key Roles and Responsibilities for Data Analyst
Responsible for analyzing data in response to new business requests, performing maintenance and changes on interfaces, and identifying and resolving data discrepancies across multiple business applications.
Works directly with the client user community and business analysts to investigates and resolves data issues across platforms and applications, including discrepancies of definition, format and function and advises on best reporting practices.
Determines and documents data mapping rules for movement of medium to high complexity data between applications. Adheres to and promotes the use of data administration standards.
Work independently to gather requirements and deliver on a variety of team projects that enhance our Adobe Analytics implementation.
Supports data selection, extraction, and cleansing for corporate applications, including data warehouse and data marts.
Support continuous improvement by investigating alternatives and new technologies and presenting these for architectural and functional reviews.
Design and recommend system enhancements for Adobe Analytics and its integration with Adobe Audience Manager and Adobe Test & Target.
Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for improving delivery of analytics.
Provides direction and technical or analytical guidance to teams that span multiple organizations and may also include outside suppliers/vendors.
Extracts and analyzes data from specific applications, systems and/or databases to create reports and provide recommendations based on the analysis of the data

What you’re about to read is NOT your typical job description, and that’s simply because we’re not looking for any typical person to join our team. If you find yourself thinking, “Hey this place sounds awesome” AND “I totally fit this bill” then we want you! Just know that we will absolutely hold off on hiring until we find the right person, BUT that this is absolutely one of the best places to work (we even have awards that back up our claims :)
JourneyTEAM
JourneyTEAM is more than just a place to work; we are an organization that values creativity, innovative thinking, diversity and fun. We offer a great opportunity to work alongside highly intelligent and motivated people. Founded in 1993, JourneyTEAM has grown from a small software development shop into an award-winning, business-technology consulting firm. We are a Microsoft Gold Certified Partner that serves organizations of all sizes, including many of the world’s best-known brands. We have expert level consultants that help companies dive deep into the dynamics of their organization and solve complex issues that will improve a company’s sales, marketing, productivity, collaboration, accounting, business intelligence, and security. Awesome benefits like a fully loaded kitchen, your pick of a laptop, and so much more just round off what it’s like to work at JourneyTEAM.
Now that you know a little about us, here’s a little about the position!
Job Description
Our Business Intelligence Agency team started in October of 2018 and is quickly growing. That growth means that we need to grow our team, but because of the size of our team and the working environment we want to maintain, we only want to bring on the right people for the job.
Daily job responsibilities include the following:
If these things don’t sound like fun, you’re just not going to like working on this team. And if it isn’t already clear, we REALLY want you to like working on our team! :)
Leverage Power BI to develop internal reports with high validity to be used in daily operations.
Work with clients to assess their current organizational situation. Create project plans to address concerns while offering the correct solutions to their specific scenarios. We recognize that not all options will fit each customer the same and will adjust our approach based on the specific needs of the customer.
Build rapport with customers and work to develop long-term relationships through delivering projects on-time, under budget, and by being genuinely fun to work with. We fully understand that without our customers, we don’t have jobs; building and maintaining good relationships with our customers is not only good for business, it’s good business.
Create reports, dashboards, queries, data transformations, and other data related objects to change the paradigm in which a client is operating. We believe in being the catalyst in the transformation an organization will go through when they successfully use their data to grow and drive their business. This one is big. If you don’t love working with data, you won’t love this job.
Creating training videos and content; leading training classes in-person and virtually. Not only is learning important for us, we believe learning is important for our customers. By teaching (instead of insisting that we are the only ones capable of doing the work), we build better relationships, and enable the customer to be successful on their own.
Actively participating in the growth of our team at JourneyTEAM. We believe having a growth mindset isn’t just a business term, it’s a way of life. (If you haven’t read Mindset by Carol Dweck, you should. It’s a great book) (and if you don’t like reading books, you should. Reading books makes you a better person (Winston Churchill said so.)).
Willingly admitting faults and striving to be a better person, team member, spouse, and contributing member of society. We know that “Leadership is not about titles or the corner office. It’s about the willingness to step up, put yourself out there, and lean into courage.” (Dare to Lead. Read this one too. You’ll like it.).
Basic Qualifications
These are the things we need you to have so that you can be successful. These aren’t just “nice to have’s”, these are “can’t do without’s”.
Have an innate, insatiable appetite for learning.
Be a world-class team member who is humble, hungry, and smart (look it up if you don’t recognize the reference). Working with others is not only something you can do, but something you actually enjoy doing.
Be able to see and find opportunities in data and then clearly express those opportunities visually and verbally (both for the technically savvy and those less so)
Be familiar with 3 of the following 6 tools: Power BI, Flow, Power Apps, Azure/SQL Server, Azure/SQL Reporting Services, Azure/SQL Analysis
Be very fun to work with.
Preferred Qualifications
Able to program in the following languages: SQL, Python, R, DAX, M.
An understanding of, and love for, the SCRUM method of agile project management.
Prior experience as a DBA, Business Analyst, Business Intelligence Engineer, Data Engineer, Data Analyst, or another data related position.
Clear understanding of statistics and how they impact the proper representation of data for a customer
Experience developing in Power BI, Power Query, and generally the Power Platform

Honey is a fast-growing startup based in Los Angeles. Our online shopping platform offers users a smarter way to shop. Through a simple browser extension, we open up instant access to exclusive savings, deals, rewards and discovery, all powered by the collective knowledge of Honey's community of online shoppers. We are helping millions save when they shop online, and we're hiring! We are actively seeking a Marketing Data Analyst to join the Analytics Team in our Los Angeles office.

About The Team:
We work closely with the Marketing, Product and Engineering teams to gather insights from data to better connect customers with Honey. In addition to working closely with one another, we also have autonomy in getting to work on projects that interest us as it relates to business needs.

What You'll Do:
As a Marketing Data Analyst at Honey, you will:
Deliver ad hoc and recurring insights into marketing campaign and strategy performance
Create, measure, and analyze various KPIs to inform decisions and support recommendations across customer acquisition and onboarding campaigns
Inform marketing implementation, attribution, and campaign measurement across digital and off-line channels
Implement innovative quantitative analyses, try new data wrangling techniques, and experiment with new visualization tools to deliver scalable analytics
Partner with analysts and engineers to build tools and processes to automate data capabilities
Work closely with the marketing, product and engineering departments to understand, solve, and anticipate their analytics needs
Foster a culture of transparency: act as the main liaison between other departments to ensure data accuracy and uniform understanding of key metrics
Possess excellent communication and presentation skills
About You:
More than 2 years working in a marketing analytics role, affiliate marketing and/or agency experience is a plus
At least 2 years of experience with dashboarding tools like Tableau or similar (Periscope Data preferred)
Practical expertise with SQL; BigQuery or experience with streaming data preferred
Advanced experience with Google Analytics, Google Ads, Facebook Ads Manager and other marketing or ad platform data preferred
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment
Working knowledge of Python, R, and/or other data wrangling capabilities are a plus
Prior experience at a tech company is a plus

As one of the nation’s leading pediatric health care systems, Nemours is committed to providing all children with their best chance to grow up healthy. We offer integrated, family-centered care to more than 300,000 children each year in our pediatric hospitals, specialty clinics and primary care practices in Delaware, Florida, Maryland, New Jersey and Pennsylvania. Nemours strives to ensure a healthier tomorrow for all children – even those who may never enter our doors – through our world-changing research, education and advocacy efforts. At Nemours, our Associates help us deliver on the promise we make to every family we have the privilege of serving: to treat their child as if they were our own.
As a Health Care Data Analyst, you will join the Analytics Team in the Department of Operational Finance, which is responsible for improving operational and financial decision-making throughout the enterprise. The ideal candidate will
Be Curious. You ask why, you explore, and you're not afraid to try something new. You probably know Python, R, SQL, STATA, SPSS, etc. and you’re constantly exploring new open source tools.
Be a Data Wrangler. You know how (or want to learn how) to extract data from a database and an API, bring it through a transformation or two, and model it into human-readable form (d3 visualization, Qlik, etc.).
Be Tenacious. Complex, ambiguous problems, technical obstacles, and massive amounts of data don't frighten you.
Be Creative. You’re used to working with abstract data, and you love using statistical techniques to discover new narratives in un-mined data.
Have Integrity. You understand the importance of security and protecting confidential information.
Primary Functions:
Write code to clean and investigate large, messy data sets of numerical and textual data.
Use big data tools and statistics to analyze hundreds of millions of rows of data.
Translate statistics and advanced analytics (e.g. predictive analytics, machine learning, etc.) into actionable business insights.
Design rich data visualizations to communicate complex ideas to internal customers and senior leadership.
Investigate the impact of new business models and technologies on the future of healthcare.
Improve data-driven decision making by developing complex data models based on disparate data sources as well as the creation of business-oriented applications using data aggregation and visualization technologies (e.g. Qlik) that Associates can use to improve operational, financial, and revenue cycle performance.
Help cultivate a data-driven culture at Nemours by teaching other Associates how to use data and analytical tools to inform decision-making.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as economics, applied mathematics, statistics, finance, etc.
No prior work experience required, but candidates must have strong quantitative and qualitative skills and will be required to demonstrate those skills in a case study during the interview.
Interested candidates should provide a resume, examples of any statistical or analytical work they have completed, and upload a separate document answering the following logic problem:
Sean, Jackie, and Kris are in a race. The person with the fastest time wins the race. Here are the results at the end of the race:
The youngest person’s race time was the sum of both other runner’s race times.
Sean’s race time was half the time of the eldest person’s race time.
Jackie didn’t come in last place.
Kris didn’t win the race.
Is it possible to determine the eldest of the three runners? If not, why? If it is possible, who is the eldest of the three runners, and who won 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place in the race?

This job is in Anixter’s OEM Business Solutions and Analytics office, which partners with the Global Account Managers and field sales teams to enhance customer engagement, grow revenues, cut cost-to serve, and stay ahead of the market.

Other programs would be, for instance, developing models for a la carte customer supply chain invoicing needs (e.g. special deliveries, cuts, wire striping ect.), customer facing dashboards and analytics.

Create and run auditable reports to send to our customers to collect among other things, but mainly, our copper deltas

Develop tools for automating reporting and billing processes and create models utilizing the data to improve pricing, shipping, stocking, and other processes

About us

At WEconnect, we are bringing together technology and treatment expertise to reinvent addiction recovery. In the US alone, substance use costs $800 billion per year. 30 Million Americans suffer from substance use disorder every year, and for every 100 people seeking treatment, only 2 successfully remain in recovery. We are here to change that. We start by supporting members in the first year of sobriety and bringing clarity to healthcare systems with our proprietary software and data platform.

Each day you will have a tangible impact on our members' recovery journey and, in the end, your work will save lives.

The Role

We are looking for a Lead Data Analyst to help us scale our reporting infrastructure and uncover data insights. You will work out of our Seattle headquarters and will report to the COO.

Experience with R desired
Excellent problem solving, critical thinking and communication (both written and oral) skills
An obsession with cleaning, structuring and analyzing data.
Experience answering complex questions quantitatively.
Able to work independently in a dynamic, fast-paced, start-up environment
Ability and desire to work with a team of people solving complex problems that often require independent research

We are a team united by a clear mission: save lives, provide accurate outcomes data, and support healthcare ecosystems, communities, and families. We want (and need) each team member to bring their authentic personality, passion, and ideas to define, grow, and lead a company that will revolutionize recovery through technology.

What makes conversations great? Is it the balance of leading and listening, inferred by talk/listen ratios and word reuse between parties? Are all interruptions created equal? Do you close sales deals faster by setting action items in the call? If tackling these questions with data on our AI Research team fascinates you, please read on!

Who we are

At Dialpad, we're a team of doers. Founded by the creators of Google Voice, our team focuses on personal excellence, high-quality execution and building best-in-class software. We like to think outside the box... and when that doesn't work, we reinvent it. We don't settle for the status quo, and that's reflected in everything we build.

With $120 million in funding from ICONIQ Capital, Google Ventures, Andreessen Horowitz, Scale Ventures and other top VC's, Dialpad attracts top talent from iconic companies like Microsoft and Google as well as powerhouse startups like Hootsuite, Weebly and Anaplan. Every member of our team plays an essential role in creating dynamic products that combine design and mobility-- while also working with you whenever productivity strikes.

About the role

The AI Research team is currently dedicated to the question: "What makes great sales conversations?" Our proprietary dataset of audio, call transcripts and conversation outcomes positions us to surface never-seen-before insights in this fascinating question. We are looking for a Data Analyst who will join and support the AI Research team by making data easily accessible and by testing hypotheses on data. The ideal person has excellent critical thinking skills, great attention to detail, and a strong sense of initiative, collaboration and helpfulness.

The work is a mix of database administration, data analysis, business intelligence and hypothesis testing. Ideally, you have experience running SQL queries on large data sets, are curious about what makes great conversations, have some knowledge of machine learning practices and data requirements and are comfortable operating in an agile environment. If you're inspired by innovation and you like working with a smart, talented, generally awesome team, we'd love to hear from you!

Responsibilities

Acquire and clean data sets to support AI Research experiments
Streamline access to data and simplify query logic by building views
Ability and desire to understand the point of view of key stakeholders, including the AI Research team and our end users. Includes participating in some customer interviews and learning about sales/support workflows.
Test hypotheses with data
Given a use-case be able to recommend and source the required data independently
Requirements

1+ years experience as a data analyst or similar quantitative role.
Excellent organizational, analytical, and research skills
Excellent communicator and listener
Curiosity about what makes great conversations
Strong sense of initiative, collaboration and helpfulness
Flexible with regards to changing priorities & business needs
Proficient in SQL
Experience with Python
Bonus points for

Coursework in Statistics
Background in communication, biological sciences, computational linguistics or dealing with human data
Experience with B2B sales and support workflows
About Us

Joining our team means collaborating with people that aren't just passionate about their work but about Argentine tango, musicals, sushi burritos, comic books - you name it. Because if you're going to redefine the status quo, you need a group of people hungry to do more, to see more, and be more than where they started.

There is no idea too crazy and no task too small — we work together to make things we're proud of.

Compensation & Equity

Teamwork makes the dream work. We recognize that our dedicated team members are what make our success. That's why we offer competitive salaries in addition to stock options.

Healthcare

An apple a day keeps the doctor away - and it doesn't hurt that we offer 100% paid medical, dental, and vision plans for all employees.

Reimbursements

We offer a monthly stipend to help cover your cell phone, home internet, and even gym membership costs.

Education

We believe in your future as much as you do! That's why we offer a yearly stipend for continued learning and education expenses.

Office Meals

Bon Appetit! Enjoy catered lunches, free snacks & drinks (both healthy and unhealthy - no judgment!)

Location, Location, Location

San Francisco San Ramon Austin Raleigh Vancouver Kitchener Tokyo New York Bangalore. From coast to coast, our offices are nestled in active and growing downtown areas

Dialpad is an equal opportunity employer; we believe in creating a community of inclusion and an environment free from discrimination or harassment.

Job Description
We are seeking an experienced data analyst to help drive innovation and make an impact within the world of health. The Data Analyst 3 functions as an integrator between business needs and technology solutions, helping to create technology solutions to meet business needs. The Data Analyst 3 makes complex information and data sets understandable through rich visual formats that are insightful and actionable. You’ll be working to solve complex healthcare problems using large datasets and an array of advanced data analytics tools. Every day you’ll be working alongside energizing product teams that are eager to work with you to solve our customers’ most pressing problems.
The Data Analyst 3 resides within the Software Technology Solutions, Analytic Services department. Technology Solutions is a software development organization within BD responsible for delivering analytics and surveillance solutions that help hospitals take care of their patients. Capabilities like advanced analytics, user experience design, data science, test automation, project/portfolio management, lean-agile software development practices, and automated software development metrics are critical to our success. Software Technology Solutions provides data products and solutions to our customers using in-depth detailed medical device and hospital data to improve the safety and experiences for all patients.
Own an analytics project from start to end including relationship building, requirements gathering, solution designing, collaborating, communicating, documenting, and presenting outcomes.
Based on others' or your own design, develop, tune, test, store, label, and document code.

Drive insight by designing professional visualizations with logical and meaningful data flow.
Build data visualizations with a strong understanding of the appropriate chart types to use to highlight patterns in the data for unstructured and structured data sets
Create and drive solutions that lead to greater efficiency for the Analytic Services team and our customers.

Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise creativity and mature judgment.

Strong interpersonal and communication skills (both written and oral) including the ability to communicate technical/statistical concepts to a non-technical audience.
Strong candidates are creative, detail-oriented, innovative, and have intellectual curiosity.

Job Title: Data and Reporting Analyst, Marketing Operations
Description:
ROLE SUMMARY
Emerald is seeking a Data and Reporting Analyst to support ongoing data analysis and reporting needs of Emerald's brand portfolio as a core part of our Marketing Operations team.

The Data and Reporting Analyst is a key role that supports Emerald's business by creating critical reports and analytics to inform data-driven decisions across the entire organization. As a partner to our internal brand and leadership teams, the Marketing Data and Reporting Analyst will field reporting requests, compile relevant data from a variety of disparate sources, and deliver reports with actionable insights.

The best candidate for this position will have a core understanding of data analysis in a business setting, as well as the ability to identify relevant trends and notable elements from large data sets. In addition, you'll have the ability to work effectively with a variety of internal partners, including marketing, sales, and leadership teams, and provide valuable expertise and insight regarding the requested data.

The Data and Reporting Analyst sits on our centralized Marketing Operations team and reports to the Sr. Director, Data Management & Analytics.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Work with management to identify key performance indicators that are tracked over time and across brands, and identify and report on leading indicators that quickly highlight areas of opportunity and risk
Build standard reports that provide senior and brand management with insights into customer trends and behaviors
Partner with leadership to gain a deep understanding of the key underlying data in Emerald customer databases; work with leadership and IT to close any data gaps
Provide ongoing quality assurance and both maintenance and enhancement solutions.
Assist in in development of campaign effectiveness reporting
Working with developers to assure specifications are understood and followed
REQUIREMENTS

2+ years of experience in business reporting and data analytics
Experience in data integration and data quality projects
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills
Ability to multi-task easily and juggle priorities in a fast-paced environment supporting multi consumer groups
Ability to work independently and with a strong sense of urgency
Prefer proficient in SQL and understanding of table relationships
Experience working with Tableau / Salesforce Marketing Cloud CRM would be a plus
ABOUT EMERALD
Emerald is a leader in building dynamic, market-driven business-to-business platforms that integrate live events with a broad array of industry insights, digital tools, and data-focused solutions to create uniquely rich experiences. As true partners, we at Emerald strive to build our customers' businesses by creating opportunities that inspire, amaze, and deliver breakthrough results. With over 140 events each year, our teams are creators and connectors who are thoroughly immersed in the industries we serve and committed to supporting the communities in which we operate. For more information, please visit http://www.emeraldx.com

Description:
Clothing Shop Online is looking for a Data Analyst. Our office is located in beautiful Hermosa Beach, California. In this role, you will help set the framework for our Digital Marketing and Data Science initiatives. We’re looking for a self-motivated critical thinker who loves the numbers! The ideal candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. We want an individual with the highest work ethics, who takes pride in telling stories with data. A team player who is an excellent communicator and quick learner.

About us
Nasdaq (Nasdaq: NDAQ) is a leading global provider of trading, clearing, exchange technology, listing, information and public company services. Through its diverse portfolio of solutions, Nasdaq enables customers to plan, optimize and execute their business vision with confidence, using proven technologies that provide transparency and insight for navigating today's global capital markets. As the creator of the world's first electronic stock market, its technology powers more than 100 marketplaces in 50 countries, and 1 in 10 of the world's securities transactions. Nasdaq is home to approximately 4,000 total listings with a market value of approximately $15 trillion. To learn more, visit: http://www.nasdaq.com
Nasdaq Global Information Services leverages reliable, scalable technology and robust distribution channels to provide comprehensive index and market data solutions across asset classes and regions. We offer multi-asset class data sets, global infrastructure and flexible delivery methods that support clients of all sizes and types.
The Team
The Nasdaq Market Data team is located globally with a team located in India, Europe, Philippines, and the U.S. All teams support the operations of NASDAQ’s Global Data Products. Nasdaq Global Data Products focus on creating innovative data products that provide superior market transparency to institutional, retail and individual investors, and are designed to meet industry challenges. Global Data Products is an award-winning source for market information worldwide.
Your role and responsibilities
The Market Data Analyst will analyze customers’ data requirements, and coordinate with market data vendors to ensure business needs are compliant with Nasdaq policies. The analyst will interact and build strong customer relationships with a variety of high profile clients as well as engage with various internal departments.
Completes basic, routine financial, analytical and database work relating to the company’s market data and billing systems.
Assists new clients on product reviews, approvals and invoicing by providing standard, preliminary information and data.
Contacts clients to collect delinquent reporting and payments promptly, escalating issues as needed
Responds to client inquiries on billing, data approval and product related questions, escalating issues as needed.
Works with providers and the audit team to prevent unauthorized distribution of company data.
Works with accounting and financial reporting team as necessary
Performs routine financial and data analysis.
Responds to basic technical and administrative inquiries, ensuring compliance with company’s entitlement, display and monthly reporting guidelines.
Ensures receipt of appropriate market data revenues from distributors and their subscribers through adhering to compliance activities.
You will need the following skills and experience
Education Required: Bachelor Degree in Business or related discipline
Experience Required: At least 1 year
Excellent communication skills
Ability to be organized and decisive while under pressure, when managing urgent and critical data feed and market data issues
Team Player - able to interface/liaison effectively with a variety of technical/non-technical contributors throughout the organization
Display’s a logical approach, critical thinking and analytical problem-solving skills with the ability to identify the root cause(s) of a problem
Exceptional experience with Microsoft Office including Excel and PowerPoint
Strong customer service skills
And it would be great if you have experience with
Proficient with Microsoft Access
Experience with Salesforce
Experience with Power BI/ Tableau

Minimum Entrance Requirements:

Applicants must have at least (A) three years of full-time, or equivalent part-time, professional experience in electronic data processing, of which (B) at least one year must have been in work in which the major duties included computer systems analysis, or (C) any equivalent combination of the required experience and the substitutions below.

SUBSTITUTIONS:

I. An Associate's degree with a major in the field of data processing or computer programming may be substituted for a maximum of one year of the required (A) experience.*

II. A Bachelor's or higher degree with a major in the field of data processing or computer and/or information science may be substituted for a maximum of two years of the required (A) experience.*

III. A diploma for completion of a two year full-time, or equivalent part-time, program in a recognized non-degree granting business or vocational/technical school above the high school level with a major in the field of computer programming may be substituted for a maximum of one year of the required (A) experience.*

IV. An official transcript from a recognized business or vocational/ technical school as evidence of completion of a program consisting of at least 650 hours of instruction in the field of computer programming may be substituted for a maximum of one year of the required (A) experience.

V. Graduation from the data processing course of a recognized vocational/technical high school may be substituted for a maximum of one year of the required (A) experience.

Education toward such a degree or diploma will be prorated on the basis of the proportion of the requirements actually completed.

NOTE: No substitution will be allowed for the one year of the required (B) experience.

About Nexon

Nexon, a world leader in online games, is building a workplace based on mutual respect, good humor, and the pursuit of excellence because we believe that great games can only be built by amazing people. Job Description:
We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to help us make the most of the data we have. The focus of this position will be to analyze data across a variety of sources in order to enhance the user experience on Nexon’s gaming platform. This includes enabling data-driven decision making, performing various types of statistical analysis, and developing KPI dashboards.

Extract and combine data from disparate data sources in order to draw meaningful conclusions and make recommendations on how to enhance our platform
Work with a cross-functional team to understand business requirements and promote data-driven decision making during all phases of a project’s lifecycle
Present the results of your analyses to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Develop data models to understand and predict user behavior: churn prediction, propensity to spend, and more
Oversee the data collection process and ensure key pieces of information are being tracked properly
Build dashboards to allow stakeholders to easily access data and monitor KPIs
Provide intuitive data visualizations that send a clear and concise message
Keep up to date on data trends and help the team to remain competitive in the game space

Ability to extract data by writing your own SQL queries
Experience using BI tools such as Tableau or Amazon QuickSight

Understanding of user-centered design
Excellent knowledge of statistical analysis
Experience extracting data from multiple sources
A quick and adaptable learner with a knack for problem solving
Efficient at managing your own tasks and meeting deadlines

ABOUT HARRISBURG UNIVERSITY

Harrisburg University offers an applied science and technology education for students who want a degree and a dedicated pathway to a career. Its focus is to educate career-minded individuals in the areas of science, technology, engineering and math (STEM careers), giving them the tools to succeed, while helping to shape their communities, locally and beyond. Our goal is to help stimulate economic growth in our region by establishing a STEM educated workforce — a necessary resource in today’s economy.

MISSION

Harrisburg University of Science and Technology is an independent educational institution offering innovative academic and research programs in science and technology that respond to local and global needs. The institution fosters a diverse community of learners, provides access and support to students who want to pursue a career in science and technology, and supports business creation and economic development.

At The Scion Group, we're changing the way people see student housing. It's bigger than beds and buildings. It's about providing an experience for students to explore the best years of their lives. It's about creating communities — both on and off campus — that feel like less like a place and more like a home.

The Scion Group is in search of a Data Analyst for our Business Intelligence team to help us explore and understand our growing business data sets. The Data Analyst will extract, combine and build models from various data sets to further expand on performance metrics and influence company business decisions. This position will primarily focus on the transform phase of the ELT (Extract, Load, Transform) process, combining raw data from multiple sources within a data warehouse and transforming it into dimensional models used for business intelligence.

The Day-to-Day

Understand the day-to-day issues that our business faces, which can be better understood with data
Research, explore and analyze large data sets to determine patterns and rules for organizing them.
Communicate and present results of analyses to management and other stake-holders.
Create, maintain, and optimize data models and architecture within a data warehouse.
Collaborate with both software engineers and business analysts to translate business requirements into technical specifications.
Handle projects from the idea stage to production deployment.
Troubleshoot integrity issues and validate result sets.

Description:
The Data Analyst utilizes their skills to ask questions, turn data into knowledge, form conclusions, and make recommendations that enable Newsy to innovate, differentiate itself from its competitors, work smarter, make better decisions, and enhance profitability. You will work closely with marketing, sales, editorial and product to deliver insights and recommendations to fuel brand growth strategy and tactics by using statistical analysis and data mining techniques.

ABOUT US
We are a small, dynamic, team of data analysts working primarily with games within the SF Jam City studio. We are responsible for providing accurate and up-to-date analysis to game teams, the studio and executives. We work directly with all aspects of the game teams - interacting with engineers, product managers and designers to empower them to make data driven decisions to enable them to meet short and long term goals. We are continually focused on improving analytic approaches, predictive modeling and longer term projects to enhance player experience and improve the company’s bottom line. We collaborate extensively with the Jam City data science, analytics and platform teams - on projects ranging from machine learning to pipeline improvements to visualization.

ABOUT THE ROLE
Are you interested in using data to help drive product decisions? Do you want your work to directly influence the experience of over millions of people playing our games on a daily basis? Do you like to automate the tedious stuff so you can spend more time using machine learning to optimize product performance? Do you enjoy learning new skills? Do you enjoy working with different disciplines? Are you excited by clean data?

We are looking for passionate & proactive Data Analyst to join our team! You will have the opportunity to collaborate with some of the gaming industry's top professionals, touching on large amounts of data, and helping our teams make quick & impactful changes to our games.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Work with product managers and designers to design and validate analytics tracking in game to ensure accuracy of and depth of reporting.
Work with product managers and designers to provide analysis of player behavior and overall game performance using our top of the line data warehouse.
Create easily interpretable live dashboards to allow for rapid analysis of product health, feature prioritization, event performance and monetization.
Identify and drive analytics projects (data science, visualization, pipeline improvements, data democratization, ab test analysis, etc.) that you want to work on that will provide positive ROI for the studio and company. You will have ownership and responsibility for the projects you are working on.
Collaborate on machine learning/other data science projects with other data scientists/analysts company wide to improve monetization and engagement.
Help design and analyze AB tests to test hypotheses in game.
QUALIFICATIONS
You should be passionate and self-driven with the ability and desire to learn quickly.
B.A. or B.S. in a quantitative field is ideal but if you have strong analytics chops then we’re interested in talking to you.
Ideally 3+ years in an analyst/data scientist role at a mobile gaming company, or similar experience.
Knowledge of statistics and statistical models (linear/logistic regression, cluster, factor analysis).
Experience in analytics tagging/tracking in order to gather the relevant information needed to analyze a product and new features.
Expert knowledge of SQL, excel and data visualization tools such as Tableau.
Strong communication skills to articulate quantitative analysis in a way that broad game teams and executives can understand.
Because you are interacting with game teams every day, it is critical that you have an interest in and an understanding of how games work, what makes them fun etc.
Any experience using Python, R, Scala, BigQuery, Databricks, Bayesian Statistics, Machine Learning a plus.
ABOUT JAM CITY
Jam City is an award-winning mobile entertainment studio providing unique and deeply engaging games that appeal to a broad, global audience.

Led by CEO Chris DeWolfe, former MySpace co-founder and CEO, and COO Josh Yguado, former 20th Century Fox executive, Jam City is the creative powerhouse behind some of the highest-grossing and most enduring mobile games. Jam City’s global franchise Cookie Jam has generated more than half a billion dollars, and Panda Pop has more than 120 million downloads to date.

The company also is the go-to studio for Hollywood, having developed immersive, narrative-rich mobile games around iconic entertainment brands. The company’s popular RPG game Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery was the #1 game in more than 40 countries at its launch in April 2018.

Jam City has nine studios located in Los Angeles (HQ), Berlin, Buenos Aires, Bogotá, Burbank, Cedar Falls, San Diego, San Francisco, and Toronto.

Career Summary
We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our growing operations team. A successful Data Analyst will be responsible for extracting raw data across multiple systems, consolidating and optimizing it into a usable format for presentations and other reporting, including productivity metrics and productivity improvement analysis. The ideal candidate will be a problem solver with advanced knowledge of Excel creating pivot tables, VBA and/or other systems. Someone who enjoys data optimization and cleansing using formulas will do well in this role. The Data Analyst will support our COO and his team as needed with monthly closing, financial reporting, forecasting, and other ad-hoc reporting. This individual will be be self-directed, solutions-oriented and comfortable supporting multiple teams, systems and products.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Extract data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases, data integrity and handle data loads
Interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques
Develop and implement data collection and data analysis systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Improve report automation

Improve KPI reporting process:
Define and improve Board reporting package
Facilitate consistent and timely delivery of required data elements to department heads

Actively engage in development of business plan and budgeting process
Support senior management with ad hoc analysis as needed

Advanced MS Excel knowledge including pivot tables, formulas and VBA code (Visual Basis for Application)
Experience with writing macros, including macros that take user input (user interface experience is a plus)
Strong analytical skills related to working with unstructured data
A successful history of manipulating, extracting and merging data from discounted datasets

We need talent like you to fuel this next-generation ecosystem.

MediaMath's Account Analytics team is currently seeking a Data Analyst with the knowledge, passion and capability to mine complex datasets, discover and deliver insights that drive value for our clients. The Analytics team fulfills customers' advanced analytics and reporting needs through custom reports and analyses, advanced statistical applications, predictive modelling and interactive web dashboards to help clients effectively manage campaigns and optimize performance. This role, on the Account Analytics team within the Analytics team, will extend that value proposition to more custom, client-specific initiatives. The ideal candidate has the appropriate blend of technical capabilities, business acumen and analytical skills to manage a team of analysts that focus on the challenges of our biggest clients and uncover actionable insights that drive revenue.

Create materials (client facing and internal) that package and promote Analytics offerings.

Be fully autonomous and self-motivated in making processes as efficient as possible
QA all of their own work in addition to reviewing their team member's code to promote knowledge sharing
Maintain a high level of pride in their own work, always looking to improve current processes and widen scope
You are:
An excellent problem-solver and have superior analytical skills
Good with multi-tasking, time management and prioritizing projects and deliverables
A strong communicator – ability to distill key ideas for a non-mathematical audience
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, fun, and entrepreneurial environment
Collaborative and team focused
Experienced in working with disparate reporting systems within an organization
Experienced in working with Analytics contacts at agencies/brands directly
You have:
Bachelor Degree or higher, preferably with a concentration in a computational field such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Engineering; Masters Degree preferred
1 - 2 years of experience working with large data sets or relational databases; Marketing experience a plus
Strong SQL and Python programming; experience of at least one big data technology, e.g. MapReduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Pig, AWS/S3 a plus
Excellent problem-solving capabilities and superior analytical skills
Why We Work at MediaMath

We are restless innovators, smart, passionate and kind. Company: New York City NYC HOUSING AUTHORITY
Description:
Please read this posting carefully to make certain you meet the qualification requirements before applying to this position.

Job Description

Reporting to the Senior Physical Needs Assessment (PNA) Manager in the Capital Planning Group, with latitude for independent initiative and judgment, the Data Analyst, PNA performs detailed analyses, develops and generates reports on Physical Needs Assessment findings, planned projects and NYCHA’s long and short-term Capital Planning needs. The responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:

1. Track planned capital investments and comparative impact on NYCHA’s physical needs.
2. Monitor planned capital investment strategies for all funding sources across NYCHA’s portfolio.
3. Generate reports, charts and graphs for leadership that illustrate capital investment opportunities.
4. Conduct, analyze and prepare condition assessment reports based on building components and infrastructure needs at the development and portfolio level to make recommendations in formulating project needs, options and consequences.
5. Analyze financial and investment opportunities to seek additional funding sources for NYCHA’s Capital Plan.
6. Determine operational cost savings achieved as a result of capital investments.
7. Review and recommend technical scopes of work for projects in the Capital Plan.
8. Review and analyze skilled trade and maintenance work tickets to prioritize capital investments across portfolio of developments.
9. Analyze and track new needs identified by Operations during the annual capital planning process.
10. Utilize the Physical Needs Assessment database and data collected from various NYCHA’s stakeholders.

NOTE: This position is open to qualified persons with a disability who are eligible for the 55-a Program. Please indicate in your cover letter that you would like to be considered for the position under the 55-a Program. For detailed information regarding the 55-a Program, please click on the link below:

http://www.nyc.gov/html/dcas/downloads/pdf/psb/100_1.pdf

Minimum Qual Requirements

1.A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university and three years of full-time satisfactory professional experience in the development, appraisal, financing, negotiation, or disposition of real estate, or in real estate law, or in urban planning or analytical or coordination work related to housing programs; or

2. A four year high school diploma or its educational equivalent approved by a State's Department of Education or a recognized accrediting organization and seven years of full-time satisfactory experience as described in "1" above; or

3.A satisfactory combination of education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" or "2" above. Graduate study in the field of urban studies, city planning, business or public administration, finance, architecture, engineering or other related fields may be substituted for up to one year of the required experience on the basis of 30 credits equaling one year of experience. Graduation from an accredited law school may be substituted for one year of the required experience. However, all candidates must have at least two years of experience as described above.

Preferred Skills

1. Strong verbal skills; ability to write clearly and persuasively; discipline to work independently or in complex group dynamics and meet short time frames.
2. Ability to synthesize complex data and present information to those unfamiliar with source material; ability to work well among a diverse population of stakeholders.
3. Advanced skill using Word, Excel, and Power Point software.
4. Database management and reporting experience and knowledge of project management software programs.
5. Ability to create, modify and update reports utilizing various department data sources.

Additional Information

1. Employees serving in the titles of or who meet the qualification requirements for Economist L3 and City Research Scientist L2 will be considered.
2. Candidates may be given a skills assessment as part of the interview process.
3. NYCHA employees applying for promotional, title or level change opportunities must have served a period of one year in their current title and level (if applicable).

To Apply

Click the "Apply Now" button.

Residency Requirement

NYCHA has no residency requirements.
