Come join the exciting world of Power Delivery Information Technology! We develop the technology solutions that enable FPL to operate one of the most advanced electric networks in the nation.
Job Overview
This position is a IT Business Analyst which supports Agile solution development needs for field operations across Power Delivery.
This individual analyzes business processes and practices in an effort to focus the design and implementation of information technology solutions that meet the business initiatives. This individual collaborates on an on-going basis with the business and technical project stakeholders and applies proven communications, analytical and problem solving skills to help support the development process, and to ensure the project deliverables meet specifications.
Key Responsibilities & Knowledge Areas include:
Possess Agile experience – SAFe experience preferred
Possess strong presentation & communication skills, with both technical and business audiences
Possesses a “business mindset” to understand operational objectives by studying business functions, evaluating how technology can enable efficiencies, and support epic, feature, story decomposition to drive digital transformations
Proven experience with the Scrum delivery model, with strengths in the product roles
Ability to partner with Operational Business Leads to understand business goals and supports story alignment activities
Ability to design solutions by analyzing requirements; constructing people, process and technology visuals (Design Thinking skills preferred)
Ability to improve business outcomes by studying current practices, identifying areas of opportunity, and proposing design modifications to delivery tangible value
Ability to work directly with cross-functional groups facilitate user acceptance testing and oversee rollout of the solutions by measuring adoption
Act as Software Quality advocate for the team by continuously improving quality automation outcomes across the team (CI/CD skills highly desirable).
Provide functional and process expertise to application developers & testers
Possess strong data analysis skills
Operate with a highly adaptive mindset & be able to thrive in a continuously changing environment
Harness creativity across the organization to solve complex problems, improve solutions and adapt business models in an ever-changing world

QUALIFICATIONS
University student pursuing an advanced degree in a STEM-related field (ops research, statistics, applied math, engineering); expected graduation date of January or May 2021
Experience in one or more programming languages (R, Python, C++, etc.)
Strong intrinsic problem-solving skills
Ability to structure and solve problems and conduct and interpret analysis independently
Demonstrated analytical and quantitative skills
Ability to effectively communicate complex ideas

WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH
You will be joining the Org Analytics team in Waltham, MA.
Org Analytics is a dedicated team of analysts and client managers, and members of the global Org practice. Org Analytics combines innovative design technology and advanced analytics with deep expertise to help our clients make effective organizational decisions.
Org Analytics helps Human Resources and business leaders to make smarter organizational decisions by leveraging advanced data analytics, user-centric design technology and proven methodologies. These approaches help clients to answer critical questions related to cost reduction, efficiency and effectiveness streamlining, merger plans, divestments and carve-outs, and talent deployment.
In creating asset-enabled practices, McKinsey is driving innovation in how we serve clients with analytics and design thinking. In recent years, McKinsey has hired thousands of technology professionals – data scientists, designers, software engineers, product managers, etc. – to serve alongside generalist consultants and identify ways that technology can improve outcomes.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
You will analyze and evaluate a wide range of data, including data from human resources information systems, business metrics, and survey assessments.
Leveraging your advanced data analysis skills, you will create innovative approaches to answer our clients’ most relevant talent questions. You will work on a variety of problems across many different industries, such as a top-tier professional services company trying to improve the efficiency of their recruiting pipeline, an insurance company facing high, inexplicable attrition, and a major pharmaceutical company in need of a road-map to better understand their future talent needs.
You will work with clients and our team to translate clients’ questions into analytical problems, manage the entire data cleaning pipeline, apply machine learning algorithms and data visualization techniques, generate insights, and communicate them back to clients.
Working on projects and exchanging experiences with your colleagues means you will face new intellectual challenges on a daily basis, while continuously building your methodological knowledge and skills.

Our Loews Hotels & Co Home Office teams provide support to all our properties throughout the United States and Canada. Our talented teams provide guidance over strategic planning, operations, revenue management, communications, marketing, finance, human resources, and information technology. This position is based at the Loews Hotels & Co Business Services Center in downtown Nashville, TN.
Essential Functions & Responsibilities

Collaborate with business team members, technical leads, and company leadership to analyze, define and documents functional and non-functional business requirements utilizing standard business analyst toolsets including use cases, prototypes, data dictionaries, entity-relationship diagrams, and business cases.
Provide guidance and serve as the point of escalation for complex data, reporting and system issues including formulating a plan to analyze, identify, test and resolve operational issues.
Analyze the full lineage of data that shows up in the report. Starting from the report, work backward to the reporting layer, the staging layer, the feeds from the source system and if necessary, the source system to find the root cause of an issue or question the user has for a report.
Interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques to support corporate and property-level operating teams with the goal of educating users, supporting fellow team members, and ultimately driving growth.
Provides first-level support to resolve incidents or fulfill requests received from the users; works with enterprise subject matter experts and technical resources to research and resolve issues; provides status on user issues.
Review requests for new reports, workflow changes, and various solution enhancements; provide recommendations for their implementation.
Maintain and promote data standardization and provide data configuration support for internal systems to include PMS, IDeaS, Delphi.FDC/Salesforce, Sabre SynXis, along with other Guest Engagement and IT systems.
Design, build and test Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services reports, including Report Designer and Report Builder. Design, build and deploy effective SSIS packages
Functions as a liaison with outside vendors regarding reporting tools, data extracts, APIs, and custom interfaces
Manage multiple parallel efforts and prioritize time and resources based upon understanding and interpreting business needs.
Prepare and maintain documentation of testing plans and test cases.
Participates in the completion of user documentation, end-user training collateral.
Qualification Standards
(Skills, Experience, Education, Licenses/Certs)

The individual must possess the following qualifications and be able to explain and demonstrate that s/he can perform the essential functions of the job, with or without reasonable accommodation.
Must have experience in business analysis, leading team requirements work sessions, and giving presentations.
Must be creative while also having critical thinking & problem-solving skills
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Business Information Systems, or related quantitative discipline preferred
3+ years’ combined data analyst and/or reporting analyst role experience
3+ years’ SQL experience, specifically SSRS
2+ years’ experience with relational data models and data mining
Expertise and comfort working in SQL with large, complex data sets
Adept at writing and tuning queries, report writing and presenting findings
Experience designing and building complete ETL/SSIS processes moving and transforming data.
Ability to utilize ad-hoc techniques to perform on-the-fly analysis of data
Proficient in deploying to and debugging production SSIS / SSRS environments
Some database design experience is helpful
Self-directed and able to work independently
Aptitude for learning new systems and processes with minimal instruction
Physical Requirements
The physical demands and work environment described here are representative of those that must be met by a team member to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
This job description is not an exclusive or exhaustive list of all job functions that a team member in the position may be asked to perform from time to time.

Core Duties and Responsibilities:
Develop and test applications to improve business processes and workflows

Perform data analysis on organizational data such as financial and production

Develop data models to extract, process and transform organizational information

Perform data warehouse testing to ensure quality of data units &data integration effort

Validation checks to ensure accuracy/quality of oil & gas production and budget data

Develop procedures to extract data from hyperion database, pro-count database and other SQL data sources

Design and develop the architecture of the databases to dump the data from various applications and source systems

Gather business requirements and modify to resolve business issues

Create Extract, Transform, Load process and other documentation

Work in consultation with Operations team to develop apps for business issues

Coordinate with IT Team at client side to set up database at the backend of the Application, create views and interlink the app data to other software platforms

Coordinate with IT and Operations teams on project status, change management and technical issues

Analyze data generated from app to create data visualizations for reporting purposes

Job Requirements:
Graduate degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics or relevant discipline from an accredited university or equivalent work experience.

Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.

Statistical modeling and analysis skills.

Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.

Technical competence in one or more of the scripting languages: Python, JAVA, C++/C#.

Data Analysis/ Mining in one or more languages: R, Python.

Experience with Tibco Spotfire, PowerBI, Tableau or comparable visualization tool is a plus.

Experience with Microsoft Office 365 Platform (PowerApps, Flow) is a plus.

Data Analyst
Department: Information Technology
Reports To: Director, Information Technology
SUMMARY
Conducts full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities, design and implementation. Provides technical expertise to ensure the quality and accuracy of company data. They will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.
The Data Analyst makes recommendations about the methods and ways in which the organization obtains and analyses data to improve quality and the efficiency of data systems.
Gather information from various sources and interpret patterns and trends that can be turned into project requirements for custom-formatted data output. Then present it in ways to allow our associates, departments, and organization make better decisions.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Developing and implementing data analyses, data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Identify, define and recommend new ways to streamline business processes.
Work with departmental managers to outline the specific data needs for each business method analysis project
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization.
Managing master data, including creation, updates, and deletion.
Commissioning and decommissioning of data sets.
Helping develop reports and analysis.
Managing and designing the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata.
Supporting the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements.
Assessing tests and implementing new or upgraded software and assisting with strategic decisions on new systems.
Generating reports from single or multiple systems.
Troubleshooting the reporting database environment and reports.
Managing users and user roles to include training end users on new tools and dashboards.
Providing technical expertise on data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.
QUALIFICATIONS
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field and at least three years of performing the role of a data analyst; or an equivalent combination of training and experience.
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques.
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects, Microsoft Business Intelligence, etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing data-sets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.

The Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (IHME) is an independent research center at the University of Washington. Its mission is to monitor global health conditions and health systems, as well as to evaluate interventions, initiatives, and reforms. IHME carries out a range of projects within different research areas including: the Global Burden of Diseases, Injuries, and Risk Factors; Future Health Scenarios; Costs and Cost Effectiveness; Local Burden of Disease; Resource Tracking; and Impact Evaluations. The aim is to provide policymakers, donors, and researchers with the highest-quality quantitative evidence base to make decisions that achieve better health.

IHME has an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst on the Global Burden of Disease (GBD) Cancer team, a core research area for IHME is the Global Burden of Diseases, Injuries, and Risk Factors enterprise (GBD). A systematic, scientific effort to quantify the comparative magnitude of health loss due to diseases, injuries, and risk factors by age, sex, and geography over time, the GBD is the largest and most comprehensive effort to date to measure epidemiological levels and trends worldwide. The GBD’s aim is to provide policymakers, donors, and researchers with the highest-quality quantitative evidence base to make decisions that achieve better health. The GBD Cancer team focuses on producing annual estimates by country of mortality and morbidity due to various adult and pediatric cancers.

The main purpose of this position is to provide support to key research projects through database management, data quality management, computational support to multi-disciplinary research projects, data extraction and formatting, and providing key inputs for papers and presentations. Data Analysts must develop an understanding of different research needs and analytic functions across multiple projects to best meet researcher needs. Data Analysts must be able to independently translate requests into actionable results through interactions with research databases, formulation of displays of results, and development of complex code to be applied to a variety of quantitative data.

A Data Analyst must develop an understanding of different research needs and analytic functions across multiple projects to best meet researcher needs. The Data Analyst must be able to independently translate requests into actionable results through interactions with research databases, formulation of displays of results, and development of complex code to be applied to a variety of quantitative data. The position calls for dexterity working with complex databases and the ability to assess, transform, and utilize quantitative data using multiple coding languages such as Python and R. The individual must then quality control results to ensure that other team members have exactly what they need to incorporate the data and results into their own components of the analytic process, presentations, and papers.

Additionally, this position will work alongside other Data Analysts on complementary projects and will require knowledge and skill sharing and collective problem solving. Overall, the Data Analyst will be a critical member of an agile, dynamic research team. This position is contingent on project funding availability.

Responsibilities include:

Research command

Become familiar with substantive areas of expertise to understand the dimensions and uses of cancer registry, vital registration, and verbal autopsy data and the analytic underpinnings of different research streams.
Work directly with researchers to identify the source of data used in models and results, understand the context of the data, and ensure that they are relevant to the analyses themselves.
Create and document efficient, effective, and replicable methods for extracting data, developing code, organizing data sources, managing data quality, and explaining complex analytic processes.

Data management and analytics

Problem-solve computational and analytic challenges by investigating the data, understanding the root questions, and coming up with alternative measurement strategies.
Implement code solutions in order to answer analytic questions, perform diagnostics on results, and test and assess new methods.
Maintain, update, and adapt databases containing health data from multiple source.
Maintain, update, and carry out routine but complex computational processes and statistical modeling that are central to generating estimates of key indicators.
Execute queries on databases and resolve intricate questions in order to respond to the needs of senior researchers and external requests from collaborators, media, policymakers, donors, and other stakeholders.
Bring together data, analytic engines, and data visualizations in one seamless computational process.
Use protocols to identify problems with datasets and routine computational processes, rectify issues, and systematize data for future analyses
Transform and format data sets for use in ongoing analyses. Catalogue and incorporate these datasets into databases. Perform quality checks.

General

Create tables, figures, and charts for presentations and publications.
Provide referencing and other support for publications and presentations.
Communicate clearly and effectively while contributing as a member of both the Institute.
Work closely with other team members to assist with relevant tasks, facilitate learning new skills, and to help resolve emerging problems on different projects.
Participate in overall community of the Institute, carrying out duties as required as team members with other Institute members

As a UW employee, you will enjoy generous benefits and work/life programs. For detailed information on Benefits for this position, click here.

REQUIREMENTS:


Bachelor's Degree in social sciences, engineering, computer science or related field plus two years' related experience or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Additional Requirements:
Demonstrated success in developing code in R and/or Python (STATA is a plus).
Interest in global health, population health, and/or ways in which quantitative research and data science can be used to create valuable global public goods.
Demonstrated self-motivation, ability to absorb detailed information, flexibility, and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, energetic, highly creative and entrepreneurial environment.
Ability to learn new information quickly and to apply analytic skills to better understand complex information in a systematic way.
Strong quantitative aptitude.

Equivalent education/experience will substitute for all minimum qualifications except when there are legal requirements, such as a license/certification/registration.


Weekend and evening work sometimes required.

If you select to take it later, it will appear on your "My Jobs" page to take when you are ready. Please note that your application will not be reviewed, and you will not be considered for this position until all required assessments have been completed.

Title:
Topological Data Analyst Intern
Summer of Topological Data Analyst (SOTDA) Intern
The Summer of TDA (SoTDA) is now accepting applications for a ten-week internship running 1 Jun 2020 - 7 Aug 2020. We are currently seeking students (undergrad, masters, or Ph.D) or recently graduated individuals (within 1 year with similar degrees) who have a background in computer science, computer engineering, data science or related fields with additional experience or exposure to machine learning, statistics, and data visualization. Exposure or course work related to Topological Data Analysis (TDA) is preferred, but not required. The 10-week long internship will focus on advancing state-of-the-art TDA approaches as the principle methodology for creating explainable artificial intelligent (XAI) demonstrations across a number of data challenges. Interns will work closely with Air Force Research Laboratory government mentors, industry partners, and academic collaborators to formulate innovative solutions to challenging, big-data problems. Guest speakers across government, industry, and academia will deliver both instruction and guest lectures throughout the duration of the program. The ten-week "hack-a-thon" will be centered at the Wright Brother's Institute, 2nd Street Location, in the heart of downtown Dayton. This location, called Project 444, is an open air workspace where selected interns will work daily in multidisciplinary teams, while having easy access to the growing downtown economic redevelopment area.
WHO : Current or recently graduated undergraduate or graduate students may apply
WHAT : Immersive 10-week course in Topological Data Analysis with machine learning and visualization integration
WHEN : 1 Jun 2020 - 7 Aug 2020
WHERE : Wright Brother's Institute, Project 444, 2nd Street, Downtown Dayton, OH
PAY : $20/hr Accepted interns will become employees of KBR over the duration of the internship
HOUSING : Multiple options for housing will be available, but it will be up to the interns to secure housing during the internship. Downtown apartments, long term Airbnb, or lower cost dorm rooms at Wright-State University will be available.
Application deadline is April 10, 2020. In addition to filling out the required on-line information, please provide a PDF resume with 1-2 additional references. Consideration for internship is limited to U.S. citizens and green card holders/permanent residents and status should be included within the application.
Executive Summary.
Currently across almost all sectors of government, academia, and industry, we are witnessing wide-scale integration of machine learning and artificial intelligent approaches that intend to dramatically impact data-to-decision speeds. Within this domain, a number of different approaches are being rapidly matured to match the exponential growth in data. In the Air Force Research Laboratory, 711th Human Performance Wing Airman Systems Directorate, we are developing advanced methods utilizing the mathematical underpinnings of topological data analysis (TDA) to autonomously architect and exploit solutions to challenging big-data problems. Some of these applications have revealed potentially paradigm-shifting advances across domains that include automated target recognition, persistent physiological and cognitive monitoring, Air Force-wide force health monitoring capabilities, image analytics, and rapid multi-modal data fusion. In our approaches, we are constructing thousands of connected TDA models in an ensemble analytical framework that forms the basis for an explainable artificial intelligent approach (XAI). This XAI approach gives the prediction and classification accuracies seen in the best performing black-box machine learning approaches, while retaining a fully explainable architecture that can be continuously mined for non-hypothesized understanding, uncover and prioritize hidden correlations in the data, increase trust in derived solutions, provide a framework for data visualization, and ensure that the underlying machine learning solution is obeying commander's intent.
The Summer of TDA program, Jun 1 – Aug 7 2020, seeks to rapidly mature TDA efforts being developed within the 711thHPW/RH in coordination with multiple universities, government agencies, and industry. We wish to invite 20-30 interns to be hosted at Wright Brothers Institute, an adjunct off-site facility near Wright-Patterson AFB. The goals include: (1) developing end-to-end TDA XAI methodologies for the most challenging data sets where sponsors require the precision of machine learning and explainability of the solution space, (2) develop bio-inspired strategies for rationally architecting and connecting millions of ensemble topological models into an integrated AI framework, (3) rapidly instantiate, test, validate, and deliver an advanced technology demonstration highlighting XAI and TDA integration coupled with dynamic visualization and immersive environments, and (4) strategically identify, develop, and recruit the future workforce who have competency in this rapidly emerging area. Additionally, the Summer of TDA promotes the creation of a multidisciplinary/multi-institutional center of gravity where collaborators can convene, work together, and develop next-generation XAI approaches that have significant benefit to the U.S. Department of Defense.
Scheduled Weekly Hours:
40

Amazon’s Worldwide Technology Deployment team is working to transform how we delight customers by driving strategic technology innovations in our global operations. We are a fast paced, innovative engineering team working with our internal product teams to deploy automation solutions to enable Amazon’s growth and scale.

The Business Analytics and Decision Support (BADS) team curates data for analyses, business reviews and operational reporting demands, and manages an analytics platform for our organization to monitor KPIs and provide actionable insights in support of our customers.

The team is seeking a seasoned analyst who has demonstrated ability to utilize metrics, statistical analysis and visualization tools to dive deep into complex issues while deriving actionable results from operational and enterprise data. A successful candidate has outstanding business acumen, a restlessness to answer “why?” questions, and are passionate about using data to drive decision making.

In this role, our Business Intelligence Analyst will work with cross functional partners to determine business requirements, establish priorities, define key performance indicators (KPI), and further enhance our analytics strategy. This includes working with business operations, technology support, automation deployment and software development teams to design and document business processes, dashboards, alerts, and reports. This individual will provide critical insight and deep dive analytics into areas such as operational process improvement, supply chain logistics, resource optimization, and capacity planning to deliver on strategic business requirements.

They will be accountable for leading independent initiatives in facilitating information gathering, developing structured documentation and presenting their findings to multiple levels of management. They will conduct analyses of existing business processes and participate in the development and support of process changes for complex technology automation projects.

Key Responsibilities include:
Identify, develop, manage, and execute analyses to support problem statements and current state measurement. Design new metrics and enhance existing metrics to support the future state of business processes and ensure sustainability.
Deep dive into large data sets to answer key business questions using SQL, Excel, and other data manipulation languages.
Lead deep dive discussions into operational analysis and gap reporting to identify defects, opportunities, and efficiencies across global teams. Identify, develop and execute data analyses to monitor operational performance and customer trends to uncover areas of opportunity.
Report key insight trends, using statistical rigor to simplify and inform the larger team of noteworthy story lines.
Maintain data integrity, perform QA Audits and diligently troubleshoot issues.
Continually improve ongoing reporting and analysis processes, while automating or simplifying self-service support and access to authoritative data sets.
Own and perform individual deep dive analyses, including communicating results and implications to business leaders.
Generate daily, weekly, and monthly data reports for both internal and external business reviews.
Respond with urgency to high priority requests from senior business leaders.
Learn and understand a broad range of Amazon’s data resources and know how, when, and which to use and which not to use.

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.

Strong communication and interpersonal skills to convey key insights from complex analysis and ability to effectively communicate with both technical and non-technical teams.
Self-motivated and able to own workload to deliver results on self-driven deadlines.
Ability to meet deadlines and prioritize workloads/projects in a fast-paced environment.
Understanding of Amazon data structures and architecture.
Amazon operational business understanding, including potential impact of business decisions on various internal/external stakeholders.

Experience in developing with Tableau or similar data visualization platform.

Summary:

Title: Data Management and Reporting Internship

Summary: Summer 2020 (Unpaid)

Mission of Organization:

The mission of the Boston Tax Help Coalition is to broaden pathways from poverty to financial empowerment by maximizing the impact of the earned income and other tax credits through quality, free tax preparation, financial education and economic stability opportunities.

Project Descriptions:

The Data Management and Reporting Intern will work with the Coalition’s Operations Manager and Development Coordinator to create statistical tabulations and analyses that detail and promote the organization’s achievements. Specific tasks shall include, but not necessarily be limited to:

Coordinate the revising of client survey instruments;
Become familiar with the Coalition’s data collection, analysis, and reporting process, including relevant stakeholders;
Work with Coalition staff and stakeholders to identify key data points and analyses to be included in reporting efforts;
Ensure all relevant data is cleaned, processed and ready for use;
Assist with report production via data tabulation and analysis; and,
Perform other related duties as required.
Required Language Skills:
High proficiency in written and spoken English

Other Qualifications:
Medium to high proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
Experience with SPSS, Stata, or equivalent statistical analysis software a plus.
Previous related internship and/or work experience.
Commitment to the Boston Tax Help Coalition mission.

Time Commitment:
May/June-August 2020: 24-30 hours a week

This position is responsible for the development and execution of analyses producing client and operational reports requested by internal and external customers. Identify trends and issues utilizing a range of analytical techniques and tools. Liaise with different levels of the business, Account Management, and operational personnel to ensure the appropriateness of underlying assumptions and interpretations. Work with Management to provide direction internally as it relates to client informatics solutions/services.

Primary Responsibilities:
70% - Collaborate with internal customer to deliver client analytics and reporting activities helping to support client relationship building.
Produces weekly, monthly, quarterly, and AD HOC client and operational reports based on established templates and processes.
Utilizes Microsoft SQL Server, Excel, PowerPoint, and MicroStrategy to execute/compile existing suite of client and operational analysis materials according to quality guidelines/parameters. Uses data to answer client, account management, and operational business performance questions based on specifications outlined by the Informatics Group leadership.
Utilizes Microsoft SQL Server, Excel, PowerPoint, and MicroStrategy to execute/compile existing suite of Stewardship materials according to quality guidelines/parameters.
20% - Work with Management to help maintain and update tools and templates to allow for the successful execution of analytic deliverables.
Engage with Informatics members as well as Informatics Group leadership to ensure materials are current/up to date accordingly.
Maintains/updates applicable documentation as needed based on feedback/direction from the Informatics Group leadership.
10% - Participate in various activities and projects to help improve reporting working in different databases.
Cross train with team members working in different areas.
Other Informatics group projects as directed by Informatics Group leadership.
Competencies:
Analytical Skills – Analyzing and synthesizing information to understand issues and identify options. Able to translate business requirements into reporting/analysis requirements. Ability to utilize prospective business models.
Critical Thinking – Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.
Computer Skills –
Proficient with Microsoft Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) with intermediate Microsoft Excel knowledge
Experience using data warehouse or analytical tools for business purposes
Demonstrates intermediate skills and ability to read/write SQL
Experience writing Microsoft SQL code a plus
Organizing and Planning - Ability to plan, organize and prioritize work, balancing resources, skills, priorities and timescales to achieve objectives.
Understanding the Business – Knows the business and the mission-critical technical and functional skills needed to do the job; understands various types of business propositions and understands how businesses operate in general; learns new methods and technologies easily. Understands the organization’s business model and competitive position in the marketplace.
Adaptability - Ability to respond and adapt to changing circumstances.
Communicating Effectively – Writes and presents effectively; adjusts to fit the audience and the message.
Detailed Oriented – Is well organized and resourceful, has the ability to reduce a complex concept or task into something that is manageable and clearly interpreted. Is able to work on multiple tasks at once without losing track; able to foresee and plan around obstacles.
Keeping on Point – Quickly senses what's the next most useful thing to work on; focuses on the critical few tasks that really add value and puts aside or delays the rest.
Team Player – Proven ability to manage strong working relationships within the company. Able to complete tasks and work cooperatively with others.
You'll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.
Required Qualifications:
BS/BA in business, information systems, or medical/health or similar analytics.
1+ year experience in healthcare analytics/reporting and/or data management desired
1+ year of experience providing analytical support to account management teams desired
1+ years of experience in Worker’s Compensation field and/or pharmacy benefit management field
Proficient with Microsoft Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) with intermediate Microsoft Excel knowledge
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience writing Microsoft SQL code

Overview:
The person in this role is accountable for identifying analytical requirements, building the standardizing report bundles and hierarchies necessary to answer these needs and analyzing the data in clear presentation format for use in communicating to the Design and Delivery teams, and the organization as a whole.
This role also requires collaboration with the larger multi-Regional teams (specifically EMEA, Americas and Asia) to provide the data needed to support fast decision-making and ongoing analysis of the business and to ensure that the reporting bundles are globally consistent.
Responsibilities:
Creation and ownership of the all periodic reporting and analysis required for the Delivery team, including the collection of data from the Local Delivery teams that includes, at a minimum, country channel level sales and distribution results. As the information is available this role will identify, create and analyze key reporting formats, populate all business trackers currently in use by the Delivery team, and produce the key reports that identify trends and areas of opportunity.
Partner with wider the Delivery team to deliver sales analytical requirements that are essential to supporting future business growth. Create and deploy aligned reporting and subsequent analysis that identifies opportunities to refine and improve data collection.
Creation of monthly analytical reports highlighting key trends and opportunity areas for individual Sales and Delivery teams based on sales, unit and/or distribution development, especially if the results have the potential to deliver incremental profitable net sales growth.
Ownership for the collation and analysis of customer sales out data to identify trends and produce reports to assess the health of the business. Partner with the local Delivery teams to ensure data is supplied on a regular basis and analyzed to drive meaningful actions.

Bachelor’s Degree required; Master's Degree preferred
2-4 years' experience in data collection and analytics preferred
Luxury, Professional Health and Beauty Experience an advantage
Experience working within a regional team or with different countries an advantage

Founded in 2001, Qlarion is a dynamic and rapidly growing consulting firm focused on providing Analytics and Data Management solutions to Public Sector and related organizations. We are looking for smart, well-rounded technologists that are passionate about helping our long-term clients use Business Intelligence and Analytics to achieve their missions.
Qlarion offers a “life friendly” work environment that is both challenging and rewarding. While our consultants develop cutting edge solutions for our clients, we also encourage them to explore innovative ideas and technologies that complement our company’s vision. Qlarion provides career mentoring as well as defined technical and functional career paths that allow employees to become more empowered and prepares them for leadership roles. Each consultant has an annual dedicated training budget and opportunities for ongoing training and certifications to ensure they remain on the leading edge.
Qlarion provides an extensive package of large company benefits including healthcare, vision, dental, 401k matching, flextime, and PTO among others.
Qlarion is seeking a Data Analyst for an opportunity in the Reston, VA area. This individual should be a smart, well-rounded, Business Intelligence-focused consultant that is eager to learn and can work independently or with a team to solve challenging, data-driven problems.
The desired candidate must meet the requirements below and will be compensated based on their qualifications.
· B.S. in Computer Science preferred. Other 4-year degrees with relevant experience will be considered.
· 4+ years of experience in Data analysis and problem solving, Data prep and quality, and Data integration a must.
· Strong Excel skills, including using Functions/Formulas to manipulate data such as V-lookup, pivot tables, error-checking, developing properly formatted reports, and using Excel in budget, cost analysis, or forecasts a must.
· Experience with ETL a must.
· Experience with BI Tools (eg. Qlik Sense) a plus.
· Experience with BI and data visualization a plus.
· Experience with public sector data a plus.
· Strong oral and written communication skills
· Ability to work independently and in a team environment
· Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines under pressure
· Experience with leading a team
To learn more about Qlarion visit our website at www.qlarion.com
Qlarion will not accept resumes that are more than 5 pages long.

Definitive Healthcare is a rapidly growing data and analytics provider of the most up-to-date, comprehensive, and integrated information on hospitals, physicians, and other healthcare providers.

Recently honored by the Boston Business Journal as one of the 10 fastest-growing private companies in Massachusetts and named THE BEST large company to work for on Business Journal’s Best Places to Work list published in June 2019, Definitive Healthcare is on an incredibly exciting trajectory. The company has more than doubled in size in the past 2 years and has over 400 employees. Our expansion has created the need for a talented Sales Support Data Analyst. If you would like to work on a product that is in high demand, and evolving rapidly, keep reading!

Your Challenge

As a Sales Support Analyst, you will provide custom sample reports to assist in the pre-sales process, proving the value of our data assets to prospects. Your work will include synthesizing data in SQL and BigQuery and delivering accurate sample reports in a timely manner.

We’re looking for a highly motivated self-starter with excellent communication, time management, and problem-solving skills. The ideal candidate for this position has strong technical abilities, enjoys conversing with clients, and has experience working in a fast-paced sales cycle.

Here Is What You’ll Tackle

Deliver custom sample projects in SQL, BigQuery, Excel, PowerPoint or other software for use in proving Definitive’s data can fit a prospective client use case
Collaborate with other team members to generate custom data cuts, analyses, and presentations for use in the RFP process
Work with IT, Product, and Sales Support Engineer teams to deliver informed analyses to prospects
Aid senior team members in creating visualizations and standardized data cuts to reduce the length of the pre-sales process
Interact with prospects over web conference to discuss reporting capabilities and data use-cases
Present complex client projects to fellow team members
What You’ll Need

Bachelor’s Degree from a 4-year institution; background in quantitative science (e.g. Health Informatics, Computer Science, Economics) a plus
1-3 years of work experience in a professional office setting, with experience working directly with sales teams
1-2 years of relevant SQL experience developing SQL queries, views, and stored procedures against medical claims datasets
High attention to detail and the ability to identify data errors in reports
Strong written communication and presentation skills
Ability to work with minimal supervision
Excellent organization skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously in a fast-paced environment

“I have waited 36 years to work at a dream job for a dream company and I am so happy to have finally got there.”

“Best company to work for hands down”

If you don’t fit all of these qualifications, but believe you’re still a great fit, feel free to apply and tell us why in your cover letter

Definitive Hiring Philosophy

Our goal is to recruit the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other status. Job Summary:
Title: Data Analyst
Location: Hollywood, CA
Who are we?
Live Nation Entertainment is the world’s leading live entertainment company comprised of global market leaders: Ticketmaster, Live Nation Concerts, Live Nation Media & Sponsorship and Artist Nation Management. Ticketmaster is the global event ticketing leader with nearly 500 million tickets sold and more than 12,500 clients worldwide. Live Nation Concerts is the largest provider of live entertainment in the world promoting more than 30,000 shows annually for nearly 4,000 artists in 40 countries. Artist Nation Management is one of the world’s leading artist management companies, representing more than 350 artists. These businesses power Live Nation Media & Sponsorship to deliver music marketing programs across 1,000 brands enabling advertisers to tap into the over 90 million fans Live Nation Entertainment delivers annually through its live event and digital platforms.
Who are you?
Passionate and motivated. Driven, with an entrepreneurial spirit. Resourceful, innovative, forward thinking and committed. At Live Nation Entertainment, our people embrace these qualities, so if this sounds like you then please read on!
The Role:
Live Nation Entertainment’s Media & Sponsorship Division is seeking a Data Analyst with experience providing impactful data insights and steering effective user acquisition and retention strategies. The ideal candidate will have a passion for solving complex problems with data science, a strong ability to synthesize valuable insights from raw data, and the communication skills to effectively disseminate information across the team and organization. The role will help guide strategic priorities by collecting and analyzing data from various available sources, building dashboards and reporting across all marketing channels, measuring campaign effectiveness, support our experimentation and A/B testing framework, and conducting research with our editorial team and respective products.
Live Nation Media & Sponsorship architects, sells and manages the company’s national corporate sponsorship programs with the world’s most recognizable brands. It is an exciting, fast-paced team that collaborates with all facets of Live Nation’s business including venues, festivals, ticketing, artists, content, media (digital, social, mobile), promotions, and concert production. To learn more about our division, check out: https://livenationforbrands.com/.
Responsibilities:
Build tooling to aggregate data from disparate analytics and BI sources
Set up and maintain KPI dashboards across all marketing channels to analyze data and provide actionable information
Measure performance of all content marketing campaigns using a mix of vendor-specific dashboards and internal reporting compiled from multiple data sources
Synthesize insights, present optimization recommendations, and use regular reporting to identify trends and opportunities for operational improvement / content strategy
Find the "story" in the data and communicate insights and opportunities with executive and other internal teams
Facilitate multivariate A/B tests on web, social, and paid marketing channels and analyze results on an ongoing basis
Provide ad-hoc support of various growth initiatives including qualitative research, survey design, web/product development, and more
Qualifications:
1-2 years of experience in a BI, data science or analyst role in media or tech
Knowledge of statistics, specifically experimental design and study
Familiarity with common web and social tools (e.g. Google Analytics, social platform analytics (Facebook, YouTube, Instagram)
Experience with data analysis tools, workflows, & dashboards such as those provided by AWS
Strong analytical and quantitative skills coupled with the ability to communicate and implement content marketing strategy
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with an emphasis on taking a data-focus approach
Strong interest in music and pop culture, with extensive knowledge of current and emerging artists
Demonstrated ability to multi-task, prioritize, self-start, contribute under pressure and meet tight deadlines
Working knowledge of Google Drive, and Microsoft Office (especially Excel), Slack, Box and Basecamp is a plus
Proficiency in using Python and/or R to perform data analysis
Strong NumPy/PANDAS skills a plus
Strong grasp of SQL database usage
Experience with building dashboards using tools like Google Data Studio, Amazon Quicksight or Tableau
If the above description sounds like you and fits your background, apply online at www.livenationentertainment.com/careers to join the Live Nation Entertainment team today!
Applicants for employment in the U.S. must possess work authorization which does not require sponsorship by the employer for a visa.
EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY
Live Nation Entertainment strongly supports equal employment opportunity for all applicants regardless of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by state or federal law.
HIRING PRACTICES
The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.
Live Nation Entertainment recruitment policies are designed to place the most highly qualified persons available in a timely and efficient manner. Live Nation Entertainment may pursue all avenues available, including promotion from within, employee referrals, outside advertising, employment agencies, Internet recruiting, job fairs, college recruiting and search firms.

The Oneida ESC Group is a family of companies owned by the Oneida Nation of Wisconsin that delivers customer-focused engineering, science, and construction services worldwide.

Our family of companies include: Oneida ESC Group (OESC), Oneida Total Integrated Enterprises (OTIE), Mission Support Services (MS2), Sustainment & Restoration Services (SRS) and Oneida Engineering Solutions (OES). We integrate our staff for dedicated, cooperative, and business-like delivery of services to enhance our customers’ missions.

SRS has an immediate opening for a Data Analyst at the United States Military Academy, West Point.

The Office of Economic and Manpower Analysis (OEMA) and the Economics Department at The United States Military Academy, West Point welcomes applications for one open Data Analyst position in direct support of our mission of conducting policy analysis for senior leaders in the Department of Defense. Data Analysts in OEMA work alongside PhD economists conducting empirical research on topics in labor and public economic fields using administrative data from government, non-profit and private sources. These include, for example, data from the Army, Department of Defense, Veterans Affairs, Social Security Administration, credit bureaus, and the National Student Clearinghouse. Successful analysts are those who have demonstrated the ability to work with large datasets, have an appreciation for and experience with genuine empirical research, and have an interest in pursuing economics or policy research at the graduate level in the future. A completed B.S. in Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related degree is required at the time of appointment.

EOE- Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans

Position Purpose:
Assist in the strategic design and implementation of data warehouses, data marts, and data stores. Define data standards and models for warehouse architectures, design and build dashboards, and business analysis reporting services to assist in achieving KEMI’s strategy and objectives.

Duties:

Define and create data stores and data marts that establish and support a workers’ compensation data warehouse.

Create, design and test business intelligence dashboards and analysis services utilizing KEMI purchased software packages.

Design, code, test and document all new or modified business intelligence systems, applications and programs.

Assist with the creation, management and performance monitoring of the data warehouse projects.

Identify source data to populate and validate data stores within the data warehouse.

Identify and collaborate to resolve any performance issues with the data warehouse.

Implement the integration of Business Intelligence front-end dashboards and business intelligence screens to internal and external business systems.

Review and recommend data warehousing technologies or software packages that support evolving business needs.

Assist with the creation and development of migration and test procedures for development, test and production environments.

Meet with end users to analyze, identify, create, and deliver dashboards and reports according to pre-determined requirements.

Perform end user training on proper and effective use of developed and established BI applications.

Achieve employee SMART goals.

Perform other duties as requested.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Knowledge of data architecture, data modeling, data warehousing and OLAP techniques.

Strong understanding of relational database structures, theories, principles, practices and SQL.

Ability to create visual dashboards and drill down reports utilizing Tableau.

Working knowledge of database platforms, including Oracle and Microsoft SQL Server.

Strong knowledge of both SQL and PL/SQL.

Full project management and development life cycle experience.

Strong analytical skills, creative skills, and ability to multi-task with attention to details.

Experience with data processing flow charting techniques.

Strong interpersonal, organizational, verbal and written communication, technical design and technical writing skills required.

Ability to work as part of a team or independently.

Intermediate technical knowledge of networking and PC platform operating systems.

Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook and the ability to learn custom software programs.

-----------------------
ABOUT THE TEAM AND ROLE
-----------------------

theSkimm's Data & Analytics team provides robust measurement and actionable insights on our growing membership base. We partner closely with Product, Marketing, Social, and Editorial teams to measure our performance and drive improvements and growth.

As our company grows and our user-base evolves, we're looking for a Content Analyst to join our team. Reporting to theSkimm's VP of Data & Analytics, you will define and drive key content performance metrics across our social channels, newsletter, app, web, and audio. To do this you will aggregate and analyze content data from various sources, and distill complex analyses into clear, actionable solutions for partners throughout the company.

--------------------
WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING
--------------------

Develop a content evaluation framework to communicate content performance and best practices to social, editorial, and marketing teams
Test new social and content strategy including design, execution, and analysis
Help content creators throughout the company understand trends, marketplace dynamics, and user behaviors
Build dashboards for all levels of the company, including executive leadership, to monitor key metrics and track progress
Identify, collect, and transform data from disparate sources using SQL, R, Python, or other statistical tools
Develop a sound understanding of the role of each product within theSkimm's ecosystem of products
----------------------------
WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR
----------------------------

2+ years of experience in data analytics, consulting, or similar quantitative role
Knowledge of content performance in a social and media landscape
Comfortable with comparative and exploratory analysis
Experience with large datasets, statistical analyses, data visualization
Strong SQL skills, proficiency with business intelligence tools (e.g, Looker, Tableau)
Strong communication skills
Understanding of user segmentation, cohort analyses, regression models, funnel optimization
Experience in Media or Publishing
Familiarity and enthusiasm for theSkimm: a passion for our audience and mission
High EQ
This is a full-time role based in New York, NY

WHAT WE OFFER

Comprehensive insurance plans, commuter benefits and 401(k) starting on your first day
Competitive salary & equity packages
Flexible vacation policy and generous holiday observances
One Medical Membership
Gym membership reimbursement
Catered Friday lunches and monthly gatherings
A vibrant office environment full of books, couches and a roof deck
Complimentary access to theSkimm's growing suite of membership products
The opportunity to be part of a values-driven, hardworking and diverse group of people building a membership company that makes it easier to live smarter
--------------
ABOUT THESKIMM
--------------

theSkimm is a membership company dedicated to helping female millennials live smarter lives. By seamlessly integrating into our members existing routines, we've become a trusted brand to more than seven million people. We're fundamentally changing the way our members consume news, consider products or services, and take action on important things happening in their lives. Our flagship product, the Daily Skimm, is still the fastest growing email newsletter on the market, and we've grown our product suite to fit into other routines at home, work, and on-the-go. theSkimm App debuted at #1 in News in iTunes, our podcast "Skimm'd from The Couch" reached #1 in Apple Podcasts within hours of launching, and more than 200,000 people voted with us in the 2018 midterm elections.

As theSkimm grows, we're committed to helping our members tackle big decision-making moments in life by giving them the information they need to make informed and empowered choices whether that be in civic engagement, finance, career, health, and more. Founded in 2012 by two friends on a couch, we've since grown to over 100 employees based in NYC. We are passionate. We are a TEAM. We work hard, but we know when to take a break to enjoy each other's company. Our products help people live smarter lives and we're building a brand trusted by millions of female millennials across the country. Join us!

Overview:
Leads efforts to collect, organize, and maintain datasets; under direction, conducts quantitative analysis and research to evaluate and report transit system performance; enables, supports, and encourages use of data and analysis in support of decision-making utilizing data visualization techniques; ensures work efforts and products are in alignment with industry best practices.
Essential Duties:
Data: Lead efforts to collect, organize, and maintain datasets using best practices, including but not limited to designing data tables, applying data validation, and implementing procedures to support data needs. Assess data for accuracy, anomalies and completeness. As issues arise, determine and execute a solution, with supervisor input as needed.
Analysis: Under direction, conduct quantitative analysis and research to evaluate and report performance in support of decision-making. Collaboratively develop and assess analysis methods and systems. Implement, document and maintain analysis, methods, processes and systems. Ensure that analysis methods and products are in alignment with industry best practices and comply with federal and state policies and requirements.
Engagement and advocacy: Enable, support, and encourage use of data in decision-making. Seek opportunities to increase the use of data through improved access. Engage internal and external partners in the development, use and integration of data. Serve as a subject matter expert to internal and external partners. Regularly provide presentations and guidance to internal and external groups.
Organization: Monitor work processes and report progress toward goals. Manage competing priorities and interests. Support organizational change.
Performs other duties of a similar nature or level.

Requirements:
Minimum Qualifications
A bachelor’s degree in statistics, computer science, mathematics, planning, engineering.
Three years progressively responsible experience managing and querying data in a relational database environment, such as Oracle (PL/SQL), SQL Server (T-SQL), etc.)
At least two years’ experience in applying quantitative methods of analysis and research in support of decision-making.
At least one year experience utilizing analytical tools such as Tableau.
One year experience applying statistical analysis.
OR an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential duties of the job.

Preferred Qualifications
Experience in quantitative analysis in the transportation industry.
Experience in leading teams or projects and applying project management methods and techniques.

Data and Analysis
Software applications including word processing, spreadsheets and databases.
Principles and methods for analysis, research and evaluation; including statistical analysis techniques.
Best practices related to data collection, processing, modeling, management, analysis, stewardship and reporting; including relational database theory.
Project management methods and techniques.

Conducting studies by applying the principles and methods of data analysis, research and evaluation. Making recommendations based on findings.
Consistently analyzing a variety of techniques and selecting the most appropriate, taking into account the goals, potential payback, resource requirements and possible drawbacks. Effectively communicating the justification for choosing specific techniques and how the technique will accomplish the desired goals.
Compiling, processing, analyzing, and reporting various types of data to support decision making.

Organizational influence and leadership

Consistently building and maintaining positive working relationships internally and externally, even in times of stress and conflict.
Participating in, facilitating, and supporting conflict resolution; exchanging feedback in an open, constructive, and professional manner.
Leading efforts to collaboratively make decisions, establish and meet timelines and deliver results that meet customer needs.

Problem-solving and strategic judgment

Position Summary: The Data Analyst ensures our Experience and Engagement Team (E&E) and our organization make smart decisions based on data, not assumptions. You will be responsible for determining data needs, with a focus on data that accurately measures actionable results, gathering and analyzing the findings, and making recommendations on the appropriate adjustments to improve our marketing. You will also conduct complex data analysis in order to build a story that will be used to inform strategic decisions by stakeholders from across the company. You will be working in a fast-paced environment managing multiple projects at once.
The ideal candidate will:
· Be analytical, enjoy working with numbers and have a talent for making data-driven decisions.
· Possess insatiable curiosity and a knack for solving problems.
· Display an obsession for details and organization.
· Demonstrate confidence to dialogue and debate data discovery insights.
· Be able to make the complex simple, and explain data through stories.
· Be technically capable but with excellent communications skills.
· Have experience with marketing analytics including demonstrated expertise with Google Analytics
Requirements
· BA/BS degree in related field
· Minimum 3-5 years’ experience in a data analyst or marketing analytics role.
· Demonstrated experience and skill working in Google Analytics and related G-suite tools
· Basic proficiency in Tableau and SQL;
· Familiarity with CRMs, Dynamics CRM and Hubspot preferred
· Familiar with statistical analysis, along with working knowledge of any programing language.
· Ability to communicate technical information effectively to technical and non-technical audiences
· Strong analytical skills and experience with reporting and data analysis.
· Able to manage multiple projects at the same time in a fast-paced environment.
· Technically strong.
· Able to extract meaning and suggest action items from data, not just report metrics.
· Excellent communications skills when working with teammates who may be either data-driven or more qualitative.
What We Do
Functional Medicine determines how and why illness occurs and restores health by addressing the root causes of disease for each individual. The Functional Medicine model is an individualized, patient-centered, evidence-based approach that empowers patients and practitioners to work together to address the underlying causes of disease and promote optimal wellness.
The Institute for Functional Medicine works to advance the highest expression of individual health through the widespread adoption of Functional Medicine. To achieve this goal, our work is primarily focused in these five areas:
1. Education. We train Functional Medicine clinicians to act as change agents in reversing the epidemic of chronic disease.
2. Access. We facilitate the broadest possible integration of Functional Medicine into the global healthcare system.
3. Economics. We ensure that the practice of Functional Medicine is economically viable for providers, patients, and payers.
4. Collaboration & Development. We create and support key alliances that advance IFM’s mission to make Functional Medicine the standard of care.
5. Research. We catalyze and facilitate clinical research that supports the Functional Medicine model.
Why Join Us?
Do Work That Matters. We are changing the way medicine is practiced and transforming the health (and lives) of millions of people around the world. Every single day, you get to impact the quality of high patient care by helping our team stay informed about emerging research trends as well as supporting literacy efforts throughout the organization.
Career Opportunities Abound. We are a rapidly growing organization. As our team grows, so does your opportunity for more responsibilities.
We Set the Standard. And we continually push those standards to new heights, winning us the respect of the industry, as well as the loyalty and engagement of a rapidly growing customer base.
Support and Contribute to a Passionate, Motivated Team. Our team is hungry and inspired and we want you to be too. Strive to grow with us.
Benefit Highlights
· Two days per week telecommuting (for eligible employees)
· Nine paid holidays plus a personal day annually
· Paid medical, dental and vision insurance (dependent coverage offered at a competitive monthly premium)
· Paid life insurance, short-term and long-term disability insurance
· Competitive vacation and sick leave
· 401(k) with generous contribution

DATA SCIENCE INTERN

Inspire Brands is one of the fastest growing organizations in our industry, and at the core of our success is great people. We’re building a talented team at our Support Centers and across our restaurant system who can help propel our brands (Arby’s, Buffalo Wild Wings. Sonic, Rusty Taco and Jimmy John’s) to even greater heights. Founded in 2018, Inspire Brands is creating a family of brands with maverick qualities, each with their own distinct position, guest experience and product offering. Our brands are diverse, distinctive and fan favorites. One question remains: are you ready for your seat at the table?

IGNITE & NOURISH

It's time to put all your late-night studying, tests and projects into action. As the Data Science Intern, you will be working with our Advanced Analytics Team. You will be responsible for supporting machine learning, sales forecast development, store optimization, and media analytics across all our brands. You will also assist with other essential data science work such as data management, documenting and improving data processing policies. If that weren’t cool enough, you’ll also partner with our team to identify exciting new data sources.

WE'LL PROVIDE THE SEAT, HERE'S WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE

You love data. You are currently in your junior or senior year studying toward a bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Math, Economics, Business or Engineering. You’re also familiar with SQL/R/Python. Even better if you are working towards a master’s degree within data science or similar and have previous Marketing Analytics internship experience.
You're a team player. You're ready to jump in and help with projects to help meet the needs of the business. Even if it means eating the very last roast beef sandwich, chicken wing, burger, taco or sandwich– take your pick.
You show passion & commitment. You thrive in a fast-paced environment and are in it to win it.

INVIGORATE

You'll be working with the hottest brands (Arby’s, Buffalo Wild Wings, Sonic, Rusty Taco and Jimmy John’s) in the restaurant industry. During our 12-week, full-time internship program you'll be working straight out of one of our Support Centers (Oklahoma City, OK, Atlanta, GA or Minneapolis, MN). What else is in it for you? You'll be working on projects that have an impact on the business and learn what it takes to be part of one of the fastest growing organizations in the industry. Whether it's connecting with your fellow interns or having the opportunity to connect with different areas of our business, we can promise that there won't ever be a dull moment.

Complete job description can be requested from your Talent Advisor. Inspire Brands. is an equal opportunity employer.

A data analyst primarily works with data in a given system performing analysis on those data sets. Analysts help data engineers and scientists in understanding systems interfaces, the context and quality of data being used as part of a project.
Data analysts should have a broad understanding and have experience with real-time analytics and business intelligent platforms such as Tableau Software. Candidates need to be able to perform data mining (including data auditing, aggregation, validation and reconciliation), testing and creating and explaining results in clear and concise reports.

Job Description
Amgen is seeking an Information Systems – Sr. Associate Product Analyst, who will work on our Enterprise Engineering and Analytics (EEA) team. The role will work with the Product Manager of the Enterprise Data Fabric and will work out of headquarters in Thousand Oaks, CA
The Information Systems – Sr. Associate Product Analyst position provides an outstanding opportunity to work as part of a fun and innovative product focused engineering team that is responsible for the Amgen Enterprise Data Fabric. You would align the engineering team with business needs and play a key role in shaping of the platform and driving the adoption within the enterprise.
Our vision is to provide an enterprise level capability of Connected Data that spans the Bio-Tech value chain including Scientific, Commercialization, and Operations data. This is an elite vision that will bring out the best in the successful candidate!
The ideal candidate is passionate about data analytics and has experience in the product development lifecycle. You are a self-starter, very customer focused, uncompromisingly detail oriented, and well organized with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Key Activities for the Product Analyst include:
Building the roadmap of the product by engaging/embedding with business customers to understand what data will bring them business value
Build and present product promotion and product adoption material, and help users with adoption and training
Craft high quality of user stories to optimize the backlog and efficiency of the data engineering team, handle and plan sprints, and sprint demo materials etc.
Responsible for clear product/project communication to all partners regarding scope, timelines, issues, revisions etc.
Build and manage relationships with internal and external business partners
Develop basic understanding of core business problems and see opportunities to use advanced analytics
Collaborate with the Engineering team, to help shape and advance the data and analytics platform
Basic Qualifications:
Master’s degree
OR
Bachelor’s degree and 2 years of Information Systems experience
OR
Associates degree and 6 years of Information Systems experience
OR
High school diploma / GED and 8 years of Information Systems experience
Preferred Qualifications :
Experience in Agile Product Management Lifecycle and Agile Project Management tool(s)
Experience working as a business analyst, in a technology team
Knowledge in data engineering, predictive analytics or data science
Quantitative and analytical thinking skills
Ability to translate data to meaningful conclusions and recommendations to business clients
Effectively communicate concepts, tools and techniques
Experience or Knowledge of Cloud technologies would be a plus
Experience or Knowledge of Data management technologies like Databricks, Teradata , or Oracle is a plus
Experience or Knowledge of Data Visualization technologies a plus
Amgen is committed to unlocking the potential of biology for patients suffering from serious illnesses by discovering, developing, manufacturing and delivering innovative human therapeutics. This approach begins by using tools like advanced human genetics to unravel the complexities of disease and understand the fundamentals of human biology. Amgen focuses on areas of high unmet medical need and leverages its expertise to strive for solutions that improve health outcomes and dramatically improve people’s lives. A biotechnology pioneer since 1980, Amgen has grown to be one of the world’s leading independent biotechnology companies, has reached millions of patients around the world and is developing a pipeline of medicines with breakaway potential. The invaluable contributions of our talented Tampa team will help us develop the vital and innovative medicines that treat serious illness and unmet medical needs around the globe.
Our culture is what makes Amgen a special place to work. We have a powerful shared purpose around our mission – to serve patients. We respect one another, recognize contributions, and have embedded collaboration, trust, empowerment and inclusion in all that we do.
We equip all our staff members to live well-rounded, healthy lives. Most recently, Amgen added benefits for transgender employees and continues to pride itself on industry-leading, family-friendly offerings for families of all compositions.
Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
Join Us
If you're seeking a career where you can truly make a difference in the lives of others, a career where you can work at the absolute forefront of biotechnology with the top minds in the field, you'll find it at Amgen.
Amgen, a biotechnology pioneer, discovers, develops and delivers innovative human therapeutics. Our medicines have helped millions of patients in the fight against cancer, kidney disease, rheumatoid arthritis and other serious illnesses.
As an organization dedicated to improving the quality of life for people around the world, Amgen fosters an inclusive environment of diverse, ethical, committed and highly accomplished people who respect each other but compete intensely to win. Together, we live the Amgen values as we continue advancing science to serve patients.
Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Strong organizational skills required

Creative, professional, and able to take initiative
