Car shopping is complicated. At CarGurus, we use data and technology to make it simple, giving people the tools they need to confidently find, buy, finance, or sell a car. The best part? Our work's made a real impact. We're the most-visited car-shopping site in the US, and we're expanding globally. Ready to come along for the ride?

At CarGurus we use data, not hunches, to inform decisions. Product Analysts play a key role in crafting the data narrative for these decisions. We love to collaborate, we're excited by a challenge, and we believe that ownership enables us to grow.

We are looking for thoughtful, fearlessly curious candidates who can dive into complex data and draw insightful conclusions. As a member of a growing team, you will have opportunities for outsized positive impact through a high level of autonomy. You'll work cross-functionally with many departments and stakeholders, and gain exposure to multiple dimensions of the business.

Our team values diversity in experience and backgrounds—we do our best work when we create space for different voices and perspectives. Whatever unique experiences or skill sets you bring to the table, we look forward to learning from each other

What You'll Do:
Conduct exploratory data analysis across disparate data sources (e.g. website usage, dealer behavior patterns and customer insights) to understand the performance of existing products and identify opportunities for new product offerings
Partner with the product, engineering, marketing, sales, and finance departments to grow our business, including recommending and advocating for performance improvement ideas
Define metrics to evaluate business performance, products and experiments; build reports and dashboards to monitor and understand them
Communicate and present data analysis, visualizations, and insights to key stakeholders
Be a voice and advocate for using data to improve the quality of our decision making
Mentor data analysts on technical and professional development
Who You Are:
4+ years of experience in data analysis (experience in consumer internet, digital marketing or SaaS product data a plus)
Fluency in SQL and Python/R, or other scripting language
Strong grasp of statistical concepts (confidence intervals, hypothesis testing, regression models)
Knowledge of BI and reporting tools, or demonstrated ability in learning new tool
Ability to influence multiple stakeholders to adopt new data-driven approaches and achieve shared business goals
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
At CarGurus, we invest in our people's professional growth with everything from learning and development programs to tuition reimbursement. Want to work on projects that expand your skill set without sacrificing your work/life balance? You got it. We also strive to provide perks and benefits that employees actually care about like free lunch, commuter subsidies, and more. That includes equity in the company—our way of showing that we want you here for the long haul.

We work hard every day to build the world's most trusted and transparent automotive marketplace, but trust and transparency don't just apply to our consumers. They extend to our talent, too. We aim to create a workplace where everyone feels they can bring the ultimate expression of themselves and their potential—where you don't just fit, you thrive. In addition to the US, CarGurus operates sites in Canada, Germany, Spain, Italy, and the UK—with other markets on the horizon. We have offices in Cambridge, MA; Detroit, MI; Dublin, Ireland; San Francisco, CA and London, UK. Check out our careers page to learn more.

Organization Summary

Upstream USA is a fast-growing, national nonprofit working to expand opportunity by reducing unplanned pregnancy across the U.S. Upstream partners with states to provide training and technical assistance to health centers, increasing equitable access to the full range of contraceptive options. Our transformative approach empowers patients to decide when and if they want to become pregnant, a critical step towards improving outcomes for parents and children.

Upstream is growing rapidly and is on track to achieve nationwide impact. After launching our first statewide initiative in Delaware in 2014, we have since launched projects in Washington state, Massachusetts, and North Carolina. By 2023, Upstream will have partnered with health centers that serve over one million women of reproductive age annually across these states.

Upstream is funded primarily through philanthropic individuals and foundations, and does not accept funding from pharmaceutical companies. Upstream's budget has grown from $1.7 million just three years ago to approximately $25 million in 2019. Upstream's work has also garnered attention from many leading publications includingThe New York Times ( https://www.nytimes.com/2016/04/12/opinion/what-states-can-do-on-birth-control.html?ref=opinion ),Washington Post ( https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/posteverything/wp/2018/05/01/almost-half-of-pregnancies-in-the-u-s-are-unplanned-theres-a-surprisingly-easy-way-to-change-that/?utm_term=.f9fa42d87582 ),The Atlantic ( https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2016/05/billion-dollar-bets/481320/ ),CNN ( https://www.cnn.com/2018/05/16/opinions/delaware-birth-control-initiative-opinion-markell/index.html ),Vox ( https://www.vox.com/2017/4/14/15246794/podcast-reduct-teen-pregnancy-abortion-iud-implant-larc-delaware-upstream ),Forbes ( https://www.forbes.com/sites/bridgespan/2017/11/01/what-makes-a-nonprofit-big-bettable/#14b051d958ca ), andMarie Claire ( https://www.marieclaire.com/health-fitness/a21969793/iud-facts/ ).

Position Summary

The Data and Technology Analyst will be an integral part of the growing Data and Technology team at Upstream. Reporting to the Vice President of Data and Technology, the Data and Technology Analyst will lead maintenance and improvement projects related to organization wide data, reports, systems and technology. The analyst will partner with national and site teams such as Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning (MEL), Finance, Development, Programs and others to increase efficiency, reduce parallel processes, bolster helpdesk support, expand access to cross-functional data, improve Upstream's ability to make data-driven decisions, and scale our operations.

The ideal candidate will have exceptional interpersonal skills and be customer service orientated. They should have a proven ability to learn new systems, processes and problem solve with extremely high attention to detail. They should also have advanced MS Excel skills and an aptitude for data and numbers.

Major Responsibilities

Develop dashboards and reports using analytics tools such as Power BI, Tableau, and MS Excel for various internal teams, cross-departmental and cross-geographical audiences, and management.
Assist in implementing a central Data Warehousing strategy by interfacing with various teams to move data into a Data Warehouse, manage permissions, and identify relevant data relationships, mappings and transformations.
Evaluate and improve business processes across the organization using Upstream's stack of applications including the G-Suite, Slack, Sage Intacct, Salesforce, Paycom, Greenhouse and others.
Manage helpdesk support and troubleshooting for various systems and applications while bolstering Upstream's efforts to grow our support capacity organization wide.
Support our training efforts to help build Data and Technology capacity organization wide through specific trainings, onboarding, and the creation of educational materials and manuals.
Required Education, Experience, Knowledge, Skills and Ability

Our ideal candidate must be able to demonstrate aptitude in the specified areas below.

Bachelor's degree in Business, Information Technology, Finance, Economics, Mathematics, or Statistics
1-2+ years of relevant experience or coursework
Proven ability to learn new systems, processes and problem solve
Advanced MS Excel skills and an aptitude for data and numbers
Possesses excellent interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to communicate effectively
Ability to build and maintain positive, productive relationships with colleagues, staff, external consultants, and internal clients
Ability to work in a fast-paced, start-up environment; should be able to identify departmental needs and take initiative to implement solutions
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and meet project deadlines
Experience with SQL strongly desirable
Attributes

Confident and proactive self-starter who is skilled in taking initiative and working well independently.

Demonstrates a high degree of adaptability to work in a rapidly growing, post start-up organization
Detail- and results-oriented team player who is dedicated to getting the job done accurately and on a timely basis
Possesses a strong sense of urgency
Excellent attention to detail and conscientious approach to delivering the best product
Strong work ethic and a team player attitude
Sense of humor and affability
Interest in working for a mission driven organization

ARTAZN LLC, a Jadex Inc. company, is a US-based manufacturer of zinc strip and applied zinc products. Headquartered in Greeneville, Tennessee, we are the largest North American producer of solid zinc strip and zinc-based products, and one of the largest in the world. For over a century, ARTAZN™’s craftsmen and visionaries have fueled innovative solutions and a manufacturing process centered around maximizing the transformative properties of zinc. ARTAZN™ is one of the leading coin blank manufacturers, with 300 billion coins released into circulation, and also supplies for customers in the automotive, architectural, building, cathodic protection and specialty industries.

ARTAZN™ is committed to: always being customer first; responding to client needs with innovative, high-quality solutions that are efficient and reliable; creating value through performance.

Position Summary
Supports sales organization to optimize promotional and operational efforts through analysis and prediction of sales trends and markets. The Business Analyst will assess data like customer metrics, competitor information and sales channels to determine the best methods of increasing both revenue and market share. The Analyst will provide advice to marketing, sales and executives to develop sales targets, assess strategies to boost revenue and develop promotional campaigns and budgets. This role works closely with Program Management, New Business Development and Operations assisting with business processes to execute sales initiatives and pricing actions.

Primary Functions

Assessing sales data for the organization through examination of monthly, quarterly and annual sales reports to identify sales patterns and areas for improvement, comparing actual sales data to revenue projections and expectations.
Assess market data, including competitors, to identify areas where the company can increase it efforts.
Develop forecast and projections, using previous sales data and market trends and examine the potential revenue effects of various proposals.
Develop reports showing expected sales and the potential effects of new strategies to aid in decision-making.
Using the data and research, work with marketing to develop promotional materials and campaigns, markets to target and identifying the best way to set the company apart from its competitors.
Assess the company’s budget to guide investments in marketing and promotions. Examine projected cash flow and compare to actual sales results to identify where we fall short of sales goals.
Develop pricing analytics and make recommendations through use of pricing tools. Analyze existing pricing for strategic gaps and make recommendations to close. Create annual price increase recommendations for budgeting.
Other duties as assigned
Secondary Functions

Provide input to budget development.
Analyze operational budgets to identify business areas that are not providing a ROI.
Prepare reports and presentations for executives and other company leaders to include data on market performance, competitor research and general sales trends.
Provide advice on increasing revenue, eliminating weaknesses within the company’s sales business lines, meeting sales goals and improving marketing and promotional efforts in certain sectors.
Position Specifications

Key Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution, preferably in business analytics, finance or marketing, MS Business Analytics preferred.
Highly proficient in use of software, such as MS Office, Smartsheet, Power BI, SharePoint and ERP systems
o. Highly proficient in Excel, SQL based software, pivot tables
Proficient knowledge of database management
Ability to assess data sets and identify patterns and opportunities for improvement
Ability to effectively project and forecast
Ability to effectively present forecasts, projections and findings to executive and management
Strong leadership skills to coordinate team activities with marketing and sales
Strong written and verbal communication skills to work with departments and personnel across teams and business lines.
Good organizational, planning skills, and project management
Exceptional ability to get things done and meet commitments with and through others
Physical Requirements:
Sitting at workstation approximately 90 percent of work time. Standing and walking approximately 10 percent of work time.
Ability to work overtime or occasionally on weekends with short notice.
Typical office environment with shelves overhead and above work surfaces.

Company Overview
Docent Health was founded with the mission of helping health systems and providers make their patients feel beautifully connected to their healthcare journey. Our belief is that all patients should be treated like high-value customers.
Our platform combines technology, human interaction, and analytics to help health systems do what is best for their patients and their hospitals, in order to provide a more integrated and fundamentally human patient experience. Our goal, in partnering with our clients, is to make sure every patient feels known, valued, and heard.
Position Description
The Data Analyst Intern role is an excellent opportunity for a new graduate or current student to gain experience and contribute to the growth of a fast-paced healthcare technology startup. The role is intended as a full-time summer internship, with the possibility of extension beyond the summer period.
The Data Analyst Intern will be responsible for ongoing and retrospective analyses of product and provider data, generating insights and creating data reports in order to evaluate the current state of patient experiences and outcomes, as well as to inform future opportunities.
In conjunction with the Partnership Success team, the Data Analyst Intern will be responsible for developing data frameworks; creating stories with data regarding critical business processes; monitoring and reporting on progress at client sites; and performing investigations that inform operational changes and shape the vision of the team.
Additionally, the Data Analyst Intern will also have the opportunity to work closely with the product and engineering teams to maintain and improve Docent’s Business Intelligence (BI) capabilities.
Responsibilities:
Collects, analyzes and generates weekly/monthly data and reports for client sites, demonstrating current and cumulative performance
Acquires, sanitizes, merges, and transforms complex multi-sourced data in support of various analyses and project
Serves as an in-house resource on ways to acquire data from primary or secondary data sources, and develop data collection tools to meet the ongoing and evolving needs of data reporting
In conjunction with the Partnership Success team, supports reporting processes, creates and maintains dashboards and tools to track and inform team metrics across multiple client sites
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree. Master’s level coursework in Data Analytics, Data Science or similar field is a plus.
Competency with Tableau Desktop and Tableau Prep. Familiarity with Tableau Server administration is a plus.
Competency with SQL
Competency with Microsoft Excel, including VBA, PivotTables, and advanced formulas
Entrepreneurial mindset
Strong analytical skills with a proven ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information
Attention to detail, natural curiosity and an eye for recognizing trends and gaps
Ability to adapt to changing priorities and juggling multiple asks
Self-driven and able to operate with high degree of independence and integrity
Excellent written and oral presentation skills, with the ability to engage, inspire, build credibility and engender trust across all levels of an organization
Industry relevant experience in analytics, data management, healthcare, consulting or other relevant fields a plus

This is a paid internship position, offering a market-competitive salary.

Position Title: Business Analyst

Division: Information Technology FLSA Status: Full-time, Exempt

Reports to: Sr. Project Manager Last Reviewed: March 2020

Supervises: N/A



BASIC FUNCTION

This position will assist with all development and implementation aspects of new and modified
components to many of the software systems used within the Organization including but not limited to
our Association Management System (AMS). Activities will range from identifying the scope of projects,
gathering requirements, translating requirements into a specification document, creating testing
scenarios and testing to aid in the development of Standard Operating Procedures. The Business
Analyst will also support key team members and stakeholders throughout the project life cycle. This
position will work closely with our internal customers to ensure requirements are met and functionality is
tested and approved as well as with our contracted 3rd party vendors. The Business Analyst will also
provide first line support of our AMS for our internal customers.



ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Assist the Sr. Project Manager with various projects to include project requirements, project
plans, and individual project deliverables.
Perform requirements gathering and analysis to include analytical techniques, interview
techniques, data gathering techniques, current system documentation, and development of
requirements.
Using business modeling methods, business processes, rules and logic data gathering to solve
complex issues, development of implementation plans, JAD Sessions and key analytical trouble
shooting in order to develop specification documents.
Develop and implement test plans/scenarios to ensure successful delivery of a project.
Lend support to various business and technology teams as necessary during project delivery.
Supervise the creation of departmental project SOP’s.
Provide first level AMS support utilizing our in-house ticketing system as well as our AMS
vendor’s ticketing system.
Utilizing queries, provide effective AMS reports to departments using mutually agreed upon data
requirements.
Communicate effectively in both verbal (i.e. day-to-day discussions, team meetings) and written
form (clear and concise requirements and design specifications).
Effective management of multiple priorities as assigned by the Sr. Project Manager, and within
I.T. Department


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Previous experience with Association Management Systems (AMS), preferably NetForum
Enterprise, or Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software.
Skill in working with technical personnel and stakeholders through the delivery of software
development projects.
Working knowledge of SDLC methodologies, IT Systems and their direct implementation to
projects.
Experience in data gathering and facilitation techniques. General knowledge of various analysis
and gathering approaches, methodologies and models, such as Meetings and JAD sessions.
Ability to create test plans and execute against the plans with project team members. Lead
testing sessions and provide support to the team through the UAT stage. Compile testing
results to be shared with project stakeholders. Troubleshooting experience in order to solve
issues as a result of UAT.
Basic knowledge of SQL for writing queries to verify data desired; must also be proficient in
Microsoft Office Suite.
Knowledge of HTML a plus.
Ability to learn new technology quickly.


EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION

Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Technology, or equivalent experience.
1-3 years of experience with an AMS or CRM.

Company Description

Amwell is a leading telehealth platform in the United States and globally, connecting and enabling providers, insurers, patients, and innovators to deliver greater access to more affordable, higher quality care. Amwell believes that digital care delivery will transform healthcare. We offer a single, comprehensive platform to support all telehealth needs from urgent to acute and post-acute care, as well as chronic care management and healthy living. With over a decade of experience, Amwell powers telehealth solutions for over 240 health systems comprised of 2,000 hospitals and 55 health plan partners with over 36,000 employers, covering over 150 million lives.

Brief Overview:

We're looking for a Product Data Analyst to join our product management team to help deliver on our bold mission. If you want to change the way healthcare is delivered if you've geeked out on the possibilities of telehealth or how the storm of new virtual care delivery models can transform the way patients receive care if you're looking for an opportunity to build world-class enterprise telehealth products and if you think turning data into insights is the key to unlocking this potential... then this is the job for you!

Our current product team is awesome at:
Product management. We're not talking about "agile product owner" nonsense. We mean real product management work where shape and lay out the product strategy and roadmap to drive business results that matter.
Being obsessively customer focused.
Delivering an amazing user experience.
Getting product to market. We mean really fast. Even for a company at our scale.
Forget scrum, XP, Kanban, whatever. We have our own unique flavor of agile. And it totally works.
Driving revenue and ROI. We're not sales, marketing, account management, or customer success. But make no mistake: We Drive The Business.
What will you be doing? You'll be responsible for turning data into information and information into insights that will help us make critical business decisions to drive our product strategy. You'll be responsible for analyzing and reporting on the performance of our hospital telehealth product line, from usage and engagement to business performance and customer satisfaction, and then recommending improvements to our products to drive these key metrics. As the data expert on the Product Management team, you'll also work closely with our product managers and business analytics, UI/UX design, software engineering, and client-facing teams on important data analytics projects to improve how we track and report on our product performance both internally and to our customers.

Who are we looking for?
A strong, proactive individual with a bias for action and a passion for solving complex problems.
We value individuals with a strong sense of ownership and a fit with our collaborative culture.
Someone who has innate analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with great attention to detail and high accuracy
Is this job for you? It could be, if:
You're a "data person". If you're not sure what that means, this probably won't be a good fit for you.
You can be hands-on. All of us contribute as individuals. Yes, as Product Management, we craft the product strategy. We also roll up our sleeves and get in the trenches to get things done. If you're looking to manage a team day 1, have a fancy title, or need a corner office, this won't be the right fit for you.
You're comfortable in a fast-paced environment. If you're not comfortable in an environment where change is constant, if you value fancy desks and a predictable work schedule, you won't be happy here.
You thrive on growth. This is an opportunity to work in a fast-growing market on major business challenges. You'll have the support of passionate, experienced co-workers, but our biggest challenges lie ahead of us. You'll play a key role in finding and delivering answers.
If you're a decisive, self-directed problem solver who thrives in a fast paced, collaborative environment, and is up for the challenge of working with the best product team in the world, then we want to talk to you!

Core Responsibilities:

You will own data analysis and reporting for our hospital telehealth product portfolio. You will analyze and report on key metrics for our monthly, quarterly and annual business reviews. You will collaborate with product managers, customers and internal stakeholders, to identify and execute on improvements to our reporting.
Analyze and report on product and feature usage and identify opportunities to drive user engagement and customer satisfaction
Analyze and prepare reports on key business metrics of the product portfolio
Collaborate with the VP of Product Management on quarterly and annual business reviews
Analyze for data anomalies for early indication of bugs in reporting and performance
Acquire data from primary and secondary data sources
Interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques
Review data quality to identify opportunities for improvement in our data capture processes
Develop, analyze and produce standardized statistical reports and ad hoc reports for internal stakeholders
Be the expert and go-to person for your initiatives
Provide data visualization and analysis support for the product management team
Other duties as assigned
Qualifications:

The ideal candidate must be a collaborative, high energy individual with a strong sense of urgency, and a performance-based track record of accomplishments. A driven self-starter with high initiative and confidence.
4+ years of experience in data analysis and data engineering
Proven ability to work closely with an engineering team to understand database schemas and architectures, and review and cleanse datasets
Technical expertise regarding data models, data mining and segmentation techniques
Ability to write SQL queries, proficiency in relational databases and experience in ETL required
Familiarity with Postgres DB a plus
Ability to analyze complex data sets, including a thorough aptitude for conducting quantitative and qualitative analyses
Strong Microsoft Excel skills, including using functions/formulas to manipulate data, such as V-lookup, pivot tables, error-checking, and macros, and developing properly formatted reports
Experience with web analytics tools like Matomo
High level of familiarity and experience working with data analysis/visualization tools, especially Tableau and Looker
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets a plus
Adept at report writing and presenting findings
Proficient in the use of Microsoft PowerPoint to present findings
Ability to juggle multiple projects and tasks with varying degrees of priority in a fast-paced, high growth environment
Able to work autonomously with minimal daily supervision and demonstrated thoroughness, follow-up and attention to detail
An almost annoying level of attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience working in a company providing technology products or applications in the healthcare space a plus
Bachelor's degree from an accredited university in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics required

Here's the thing about challenges. They provide limitless opportunities for greatness. And what we have in mind for you is definitely big. At UnitedHealth Group, we're changing the future of health care and we have the expertise, advanced technology and global resources to make it happen. As a Senior Pricing / Data Analyst, you'll work with the brightest minds in the business and find yourself digging deep to find the solutions to help people live healthier lives. You'll be responsible for analyzing, reviewing and forecasting data to impact the health care system. What could be more satisfying than that? Join us!

As a Senior Pricing / Data Analyst you will be responsible for reviewing and managing pharmacy reimbursement in order to meet contractual obligations. You will need to review data for trends and outliers and provide pricing recommendations so that we can reimburse pharmacies the contractually required amounts. You will need to be comfortable with manipulating current processes or creating processes from scratch to meet pharmacy reporting needs. Day to day activities will require you to work with multiple internal partners to ensure that necessary information is passed across appropriate channels. You will need to use business intelligence, data visualization, queries, analytic and statistical software to build solutions, perform analysis and interpret data. You will need to perform normalization operations and assure data quality. You should be comfortable developing data solutions to support analyses, performing analysis, interpreting results, developing actionable insights and presenting recommendations for use across the company.

Primary Responsibilities:
Management and manipulation of mostly structured data, with a focus on building business intelligence tools
Conducting analysis to distinguish patterns and recognize trends
Performing normalization operations and assuring data quality
Developing data solutions to support analyses, performing analysis, interpreting results, developing actionable insights and presenting recommendations for use across the company
Partner with stakeholders to understand data requirements and develop tools and models such as segmentation, dashboards, data visualizations, decision aids and business case analysis to support the organization
Manage the delivery of activity and value analytics to external stakeholders and clients
Use business intelligence, data visualization, queries, analytic and statistical software to build solutions, perform analysis and interpret data

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

Coinbase has built the world's leading compliant cryptocurrency platform serving over 30 million accounts in more than 100 countries. With multiple successful products, and our vocal advocacy for blockchain technology, we have played a major part in mainstream awareness and adoption of cryptocurrency. We are proud to offer an entire suite of products that are helping build the cryptoeconomy, and increase economic freedom around the world.

There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we assess whether a candidate demonstrates our values: Clear Communication, Positive Energy, Efficient Execution, and Continuous Learning. Second, we look for signals that a candidate will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, disrupt ourselves, and expect sustained high performance because we play as a championship team. Finally, we seek people with the desire and capacity to build and share expertise in the frontier technologies of crypto and blockchain, in whatever way is most relevant to their role.

Read more about our values ( https://www.coinbase.com/mission ) and culture ( https://blog.coinbase.com/culture-at-coinbase-fe510fe9c098 ) here.

As a Operations Data Analyst, you'll be the analytical point on the team to help support various operational initiatives by transforming support data into valuable business insights and help shape our projects to deliver maximum impact. You will have the opportunity to heavily influence strategy, planning, and execution.

What you'll be doing (ie. job duties):
Work closely with the Customer Experience (CX) Operations team to operate more effectively, create and track metrics across our operations, and share informative actionable insights
Partner with CX Leadership and cross-functional partners to find opportunities to increase operational trackability, efficiency, and scale our business effectively
Leverage metrics to drive insights and influence business decisions
Develop a strong prioritization framework to ensure team is focused on highest-value initiatives
Ability to frame and break down complex business problems into key components and recommend practical solutions
Monitor key performance metrics and use results to help the team be more effective in carrying out their mission of providing high-quality support
Build a collaborative team environment that fosters efficient execution, innovation, and continuous improvement
Develop and support the analytical technologies that give our team timely, flexible, and structured access to their data
What we look for in you (ie. job requirements):
Motivated by Coinbase's mission and creating a seamless support experience for our global customer base.
Minimum 5 years of experience in an analyst function (e.g. operations, finance, business analytics, etc.)

Experience working in customer support operations; experience working in (or doing analysis for) Support departments a plus
Fantastic communication skills in order to operate across multiple departments and stakeholders.
Flexible and adaptable to meeting the evolving needs of a high-growth and fast paced organization.
Must be able to read, write and speak in English.

About Us
--------

Launched in 2011, Twitch is a global community that comes together each day to create multiplayer entertainment: unique, live, unpredictable experiences created by the interactions of millions. We bring the joy of co-op to everything, from casual gaming to world-class esports to anime marathons, music, and art streams. Twitch also hosts TwitchCon, where we bring everyone together to celebrate, learn, and grow their personal interests and passions. We're always live at Twitch. Stay up to date on all things Twitch onLinkedIn ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/twitch-tv/ ),Twitter ( https://twitter.com/Twitch ) and on ourBlog ( https://blog.twitch.tv/ ).

About the Role
--------------

Data is central to Twitch's decision-making process, and analysts are a critical component to promote data-driven decision making in all of our operations. As an analyst at Twitch, you will be in on the ground floor with your team, shaping the way product performance is measured, defining what questions should be asked, and scaling analytics methods and tools to support our growing business, leading the way for high quality, high velocity decisions for your team.

You Will:
---------

Evangelize data knowledge and insights: manage communications with your stakeholders and other teams, collaborate with both technical and non-technical colleagues to complete data projects and ensure all parties can use the insights to further improve.
Maintain a customer-centric focus: aim to be a domain and product expert through data, develop trust amongst your peers and stakeholders, and ensure that your team has access to data to make decisions.
Work with stakeholders and mentors to distill the problem, adapt your tools to answer complicated questions, and identify the trade-offs between speed and quality of different approaches.
Create analytical frameworks to measure team success: partner with cross-functional teams to define success metrics, create approaches to track the data and troubleshoot errors, quantify and evaluate the data, then develop a common language for all colleagues to understand these KPIs
Operationalize data processes - provide the team with ad-hoc analysis, automated dashboards, and self-service reporting tools so that everyone gets a good sense of the state of the business
You Have:
---------

3+ years of industry experience in a relevant field
A/B testing experience with an understanding of hypothesis testing and power analysis
Expert SQL skills--your ability to tap into our data pipeline will be key to your success
Proven track record of using data to create insight and achieve our goals
Fluency in data analysis and communication around data, including time series analysis, experimentation, data visualization, and defining KPI strategy for your business

PURPOSE:
The Enterprise Portfolio Management Office (EPMO) is seeking an efficient, detail-oriented research analyst to join our growing organization. In this position, you will interpret, manage, and analyze organizational data in order to translate results into better solutions. You will be working with various source data systems and will be required to pull that data together, conduct validation and sanity checks, look for discrepancies, and organize the data in a way that permits effective analysis. Once the data is organized, the position will be required to investigate data trends and findings, leading to the development of visualizations and recommendations. The position will be tasked to work with information such as resource allocation and utilization data, project scheduling data, burn rates and other Agile metrics, defect metrics, and other associated project/program/portfolio information.

PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Under the direction of the Manager, FEPOC Portfolio Management Office, the principle duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:

Duties and Responsibilities

Process Management

Compliance
o Supports compliance of the standard PMO processes and ensures adherence to them.
o Understands and facilitates adherence to processes supporting PMO services.

Stewardship
o Executes existing processes as written and provides feedback on potential opportunities for improvement
o Supports stewardship of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) by soliciting feedback from users and mentoring on how to follow the procedures.



Portfolio Management

Oversight
o Supports oversight of the FEPOC PMO portfolio.
o Supports collection of portfolio metrics and preparation of reports and analyses
o Facilitates FEPOC PMO portfolio oversight activities to monitor and control portfolio performance.

Strategy
o Awareness of corporate strategy.

Reporting
o Assembles and validates pre-defined reports
o Provides verbal presentations of report content
o Designs and prepares simple reports
o Develops graphs and charts as appropriate to support reporting, including metrics, trends, anomalies, etc. represent very detailed data at a summary level.
o Supports and implements presentation formats and scenarios to help convey information to executives.

Tools
o Maintains high quality of information within the PPM tool.

Data Analysis, Reporting, and Presentation

Analysis
o Performs standard data analysis, draws conclusions, and makes recommendations for risk mitigation. Data includes: Schedule, Resource, Milestone, Issues, Risks, Dependencies, and Financials.

Facilitation
o Contributes in portfolio review meetings, including capture of meeting minutes and tracking of action items to resolution

Financial Management
o Supports project financial reporting at the portfolio level and contributes to the analysis and escalation

Resource Management
o Supports preparation of resource management reporting and contributes to the analysis and escalation

Schedule Management
o Supports management of PMO enterprise schedule/calendar.
o Supports milestone-level integrated schedule oversight.
o Understands project work breakdown structures and supports portfolio-level schedule management.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Required:

BS Degree in Business, Finance, Computer Science, Project Management, or Management Information Systems or directly related equivalent experience
0 to 2+ years relevant experience in roles requiring project/portfolio management, resource & risk analysis, financial project management and metrics reporting.
Familiarity with Project Portfolio Management tools (e.g. CA Clarity PPM, HP PPM, Planview PPM, etc.)
Familiarity with Enterprise Reporting tools (e.g. Cognos, Business Objects, etc.)
Beginner or higher proficiency with MS Project, PowerPoint, SharePoint, InfoPath
Intermediate or higher proficiency with MS Excel

Strong analytical skills; passion for understanding data; curiosity, thirst for knowledge; desire to investigate root causes of data patterns and trends.

The ability to communicate clearly and effectively; must be able to clearly articulate complex data.
Strong verbal and written communication skills – able to communicate very detailed information at a summary level.
Excellent oral and written communications; an ability to present and discuss technical information in a way that establishes rapport, persuades others, and gains understanding.
Flexibility

Job Title: Data Analyst/ Data Consultant/ Data Engineer
Description:
At Vaco, we connect professionals with excellent career growth opportunities! Our team helps you get the advantage over your competitors through our direct access to HR departments and hiring managers. We currently have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Data Analyst/ Data Consultant/ Data Engineer. Apply with Vaco, and we will advocate on your behalf! We promote your strengths and experience and help prepare you for your interview by supplying you with key information about our client's background and expectations. We provide great insight about trends in the market and keep you up to date on compensation expectations, company culture and growth opportunities.
The Data Analyst/ Data Consultant/ Data Engineer, will be responsible for collecting, analyzing and reporting data. Ensuring the integrity of such data and generate reports that verify and document their accuracy. This position will be working in a deadline-oriented, fast-paced environment as part of a team consisting of consulting and operations staff. The teams' goal is to provide superior service to states and large school districts in the areas of special education management systems, data warehousing, federal claiming, and other programs. The Data Analyst/ Data Consultant/ Data Engineer role revolves around technology, policy and financial management functions.
The Data Analyst/ Data Consultant/ Data Engineer will be responsible for reviewing, formatting, importing/exporting, transforming, validating or modeling data with the purpose of understanding or drawing conclusions to drive strategical and operational decision-making. The positions responsibilities include presenting data in charts, graphs and tables as well as designing and developing system embedded processes and manual verification methods for collecting and analyzing data.
Responsibilities of the Data Analyst/ Data Consultant/ Data Engineer role include:
Compiling data and analyzing results
Preparing and distributing reports
Ensuring data integrity
Developing and producing reports utilized in measuring data accuracy
Assisting in the completion of appropriate client set-up and maintenance forms
Supporting internal and external users
Creating exception reports to identify fields of incorrect data
Generating custom reports for internal and external clients
Supporting the organization's quality program
Position Overview:
The Data Analyst/ Data Consultant/ Data Engineer will be interacting with the Product Owner of Risk Data Mart and the Enterprise Data Management Team to organize current data in the banking and financial service industries. This position would do some of the hands-on work but would also be coordinating with the other DataStage or Cognos developers.
The Business has a lot of EDW (Enterprise Data Warehouse) ongoing enhancements
Consulting will be working with Business to prioritize these enhancements
Cleaning up historical data
Sharpening data SQL logic that happens before reporting
SQL prototyping that demonstrates the output the Business wants to see
Position Requirements:
Analytical Skills: Analysts work with large amounts of data: facts, figures and number crunching. Must have the ability to design and execute import and export processes as well as recognize the existence (or absence) of patterns in the data. This Data Analyst/ Data Consultant/ Data Engineer requires strong SQL experience and thorough understanding.
Communication Skills: Must communicate well with clients, team members, and ancillary resources. This includes both presenting ideas or findings, as well as drawing out client or team member key concerns or other relevant information.
Attention to Detail: The conclusions drawn from this data analysis will drive critical departmental initiatives. Accuracy and attention to detail are paramount.
Software implementation activities including training, site preparation, and project management.
Documents client discussions, gather requirements and engages technical team as it relates to the emerging data structure and reporting needs, in close partnership with the project leads
Maintains data dictionaries, data flow diagrams, etc. for EDPlan reports and related functions
Ability to dig in with the Business and asking a ton of insightful questions
Previous experience utilizing Cognos, DB2, SQL - Structured Query Language
Database skills- SQL knowledge is a necessary
Strong analytical skills, including the ability to analyze and organize data
Excellent organizational, oral presentation and written communication skills
Research and project management capabilities preferred
DataStage is their ETL tool, but the Consultant doesn't have to be DataStage expert (some experience or familiarity would be great)
Data Analyst/ Data Consultant/ Data Engineer Position Preferences:
Cognos or other reporting background
DB2 and Netezza familiarity
Unix/ Linux
Banking or Financial service background
Loans/ ALS
CIS
Customer data
Credit Cards/ Deposits

The Business Analyst is responsible for a full range of activities which ensure the operational effectiveness and excellence of Illinois Action for Children (IAFC). Designs and documents workflows and makes appropriate recommendations that will positively impact operational efficiencies. Tracks and analyzes program and departmental trends and makes appropriate recommendations that will positively impact the unit. Works closely with agency departments to develop and oversee systems for data collection, analysis, and communication of program/departmental performance indicators. Project manages and leads a number of key projects for the Quality Improvement department and the organization. All work to be completed with minimum supervision and in accordance with organizational standards.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Works directly with the Director of Strategy Management, Program Integrity/Quality Assurance Manager , QA teams, and other appropriate IAFC staff to understand project concepts, objectives and approach.
Defines project scope and objectives and assesses the operational impacts, workflow, training, etc. of a project along with the Director of Strategy Management.
Takes assigned projects from original concept through final implementation.
Creates and maintains project schedules by developing project plans and specifications, estimating time requirements, establishing deadlines, monitoring milestone completion, tracking all phases of the project product/service lifecycle, providing timely reporting of issues that impact project progress, coordinating actions, and resolving conflicts. This includes documenting, prioritizing and tracking requests (changes, enhancements, etc.). Coordinates with Strategy to ensure that project management is aligned with best practices and strategic goals.
Identifies and coordinates communication and assignments among IAFC staff to meet the project requirements.
Analyzes the programs/departments activities and trends and compares analyses against the service standards and best practices. Presents findings and works with the appropriate staff to identify and implement strategies that will address tactical and strategic goals.
Reviews, analyzes, and creates detailed documentation of business process improvement and reporting and user needs, including workflow, program functions, and steps required to develop or modify improvement programs.
Works with IT and business units to ensure that business requirements are adequately reflected in existing and new software applications. Develops use cases to test changes and new implementations, to ensure they align with business processes.
Assists with the development of training and process improvement requirements of the program/department. Presents findings and works with IAFC staff to design and implement training and development initiatives that will continuously upgrade the skills and capabilities for IAFC staff.
Other Functions: The organization may assign other functions to the job at its discretion.
EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor’s degree required. Fifth year college or university program certificate preferred; two to four years related experience and/or training.

Salary: $53,900/yr Location: 4753 N Broadway, Chicago, IL

Beazley is seeking a Data Analyst to develop and analyze management information to support the Group Claims department as well as provide commercial benefit through improvement in claims outcomes. This will include timely and accurate production of management information to assist with claims data analysis. Support on related projects aimed at improving the delivery of management information to the business. Also deliver insight and drive innovation using internal and external data.

Operational Support

Production of regular and ad hoc management information for presentation or distribution to the senior management team, underwriters, directors, members of the board, actuary, etc as required.
Deliver continuous improvement of Management Information reporting, both in terms of the quality of output and the speed of reporting processes.Maintain the standard suite of Management Information reports, making appropriate changes in light of new MI requests and/or operational changes.

Description:
Vaco Tampa is hiring!
This is a direct-hire role for a client in Tampa.

Assemble and summarize data, make presentations of findings, and provide recommendations to support senior management decision making.

Identify reporting needs and create/improve daily, weekly and monthly reports.
Develop and maintain reports and metrics to track employee performance management.
Document and update existing standard operating procedures, process maps and org charts.
Standardize cross-departmental data definitions, KPIs, and calculations.
Share knowledge, expertise and best practices with new and existing analysts throughout the institution.

Demonstrates knowledge of, and carefully follows all applicable federal and state compliance requirements and regulations including those prescribed by the Department of Education, accrediting agencies, CIE, and internal UMA policies and procedures.

Minimum Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, Math, Statistics or Finance.
Minimum of 5 years' experience in Business Intelligence/Analytics.
A proven track record for developing, implementing and monitoring statistical models (e.g. regression, decision trees, time series analysis, classification, sensitivity analysis, etc.).
Experience using statistical and data mining languages (i.e. t-SQL, PL/SQL, Python, R, SAS).
Highly proficient with visualization platforms (e.g. PowerBI, SSRS) and ability to extract insight and provide recommendations to senior leadership.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, able to communicate professionally in both verbal and written English.

Interest in understanding business opportunities and independently execute predefined or created roadmap with minimal supervision.
Able to develop and implement operational models and A/B testing techniques.
Understands organizational levers to develop departmental budgets and targets for predefined periods of time.

Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and other business tools such as Skype and Microsoft Teams.
Able to support a diverse and inclusive work environment.

MBA or Master's degree in Finance, Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Statistics, or Analytics.
Great attention to detail to fulfill regulatory requests subject to the highest degree of integrity and accuracy.
Comfortable working across functional teams and various leadership levels to build relationships with a goal-oriented mindset.
Streamline algorithms and automate the modeling production process along with adjacent KPIs that reflect the model's credibility.
Experience or interest in the Education or Education Management industries.

Performs complex (senior-level) data analysis, data research, database management, and application development assignments for the Data Analytics (DA) section in the Center for Analytics and Decision Support (CADS) in support of the Medicaid & CHIP Services (MCS) program in order to detect data trends and anomalies, optimize health outcomes, provide MCS and HHSC executive management with information necessary to make data-informed management decisions, enhance MCS contract management, and explore potential program efficiencies.

Work involves conducting detailed analysis of data sets, performing data needs assessment, data acquisition, cleaning and standardization, extraction, transformation and loading into database systems; designing, coding, testing, implementing and maintaining computer applications to increase efficiency through the automation of routine tasks; and mentoring DA team members in the use of compiled datasets. Works under limited supervision, with moderate latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.


Essential Job Functions:
Attends work on a regular and predictable schedule in accordance with agency leave policy and performs other duties as assigned.

EJF 1: Consults and coordinates with DA, CADS and MCS staff in order to identify potential areas for increased efficiencies through the use of automation. Designs, develops, codes, tests, implements and maintains and documents computer applications to implement those efficiencies. (40%)

EJF 2: Consults and coordinates with DA, CADS and MCS staff in order to identify business needs related to Medicaid, CHIP and reference data in various HHS and other systems and transform research and reporting requirements into DA/CADS data systems. Acquires, extracts, cleans, transforms and loads needed datasets into DA/CADS database systems. Mentors DA staff in the use of data systems. (40%)

Are you interested in expanding your career through experience and exposure, all while supporting a mission that seeks to ensure the security of our nation and its allies? Applies behavioral and social science theories, methods, and techniques to develop, implement, and evaluate programs and policies impacting local, state/territory, federal, or international public health and health disparities or vulnerable populations. Participating in data analyses including development of analytical frameworks and coding schemes
Assisting in drafting and reviewing internal documents and reports

Demonstrated experience providing training in qualitative data collection methods

Experience working in a public health or clinical setting

GENERAL DESCRIPTION:

This position is responsible for functions related to analysis and information management for the Division of Health Care Financing, requiring considerable judgment and specialized knowledge of the health and utilization management data, eligibility and claims data systems, and multiple Medicaid programs and policies. Upon findings in analysis, the incumbent makes recommendations, which lead to new or improved policy and planning decisions, projects, and programs. This position manages low to high-level projects, studies, and coordinates with staff and other Department of Health Divisions. Projects include collaboration on reporting efforts and projects with the Director's Unit for Policy Research and Evaluation (DUPRE) and the Business Operations Unit. This position serves as a resource and consultant of Medicaid data, which includes reviewing and validating other programs or vendors' efforts relating to data and data extraction.

The Medicaid Data and Reporting Analyst must be able to apply judgment concerning communications and confidentiality. This position requires beginner or intermediate-level proficiency in the use of standard desktop applications and Google applications (mail, calendar, sites, docs) used by the State of Wyoming.

This position is an At-Will Employment Contract and includes a single Health Insurance plan. This position pays for actual hours worked and is limited to 40 hours per week. The hourly rate is not negotiable by the hiring manager.

This position does not include paid vacation time, paid sick time, paid holidays, family health insurance, retirement, or other benefits. These items are not negotiable by the hiring manager.

Human Resource Contact: 307-777-6780 auri.fermelia@wyo.gov

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: The listed functions are illustrative only and are not intended to describe every function which may be performed in the job level.
Respond to requests for data by determining users' needs, collecting, organizing, and analyzing data, and providing accurate and complete reports.
Analyze, collect, classify, manipulate, store, retrieve, move, and disseminate information for the Wyoming Medicaid program, Division of Healthcare Financing.
Extract and manipulate data using approved Agency business intelligence tools by developing large and complex queries. Identify trends and changes.
Performs checks and audits of various data sources to ensure data is accurate and complete.
Produces standard periodic reports to meet users' needs. Perform user acceptance testing on vendor created reports and assist other analysts with validating their reports.
Serves as an internal resource and consultant on Medicaid health data, including and validating program efforts relating to data and data extraction.
Develops an understanding of performance metrics, designs reports, and performs analysis to track and evaluate the effectiveness of process changes.
Communicate with many levels of the organization, verbally encouraging teamwork and collaboration, as well as in written format with reports and summaries.
Meet assignment timelines and due dates.
Prioritize and manage assignment workload based on users' needs and leadership guidance.
Attend data management and reporting specific training or conferences.
Undertake special projects and studies relating to healthcare and the provision of services.
Responsible for providing project coordination, support, and assistance in all aspects of simple to somewhat complex projects.
Assists in the design, sampling, and implementation of special review programs.
Coordinates internal plan audits for compliance to both state and federal guidelines, project outcomes, and trends, making recommendations on related programs.
Develop reporting requirements and criteria.
Determines program effectiveness in achieving goals and objectives by assisting with HealthStat and other performance improvement activities.
Develops and implements communication tools for new and related providers, recipients, and other outside agencies.
Evaluates budget impact.
Tracks and submits review findings and ensures that outcomes are accurate and timely.
Work with and train other analysts to perform a variety of ad-hoc analysis and reports as requested.
Respond to requests for data by determining users' needs, collecting, organizing, and analyzing data, and providing accurate and complete reports.

Position Purpose:
The data integration analyst will be responsible for planning and coordinating the organization and integration of scientific data in support numerous internal and external projects. Tasks will include but are not limited to: collecting, analyzing, transforming and loading data from multiple information lanes into one or more databases; verifying and maintaining the integrity of the data, the databases, and associated database functions; coordinating the extraction of data to support specific project needs; providing data interpretation support by generating reports, tables and graphical data displays. Some database and database tool development may be required. The successful candidate must be able to work with developers and data scientists to recommend system updates as well as new solutions, and must be able to communicate effectively with scientific team members to ensure the completeness and accuracy of the data stored in and retrieved from project databases.




Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Collects, analyzes, transforms, and loads scientific data into a database using SQL, Excel, and other programs and/or ETL tools
Prepares reports by analyzing and interpreting data
Works continuously with developers and data analyst to ensures the integrity of all incoming data, stored data, and outgoing reports to support all project needs
Interacts directly with clients and team members to determine data-related requirements and develops and implements effective data management strategies to meet these needs
Regularly monitors and evaluates information and data systems that could affect analytical results
Works with clients and team members to gather requirements and suggest solutions for new database or database tool development efforts or upgrades to existing systems, and works with developers and data analysts to implement solutions

Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Experience in data management and analysis
Ability to decipher and organize large amounts of data from disparate sources
Experience in methodologies and processes for managing Relational Database Management Systems (SQL Server, Oracle, or Access)
Ability to analyze existing tools and database systems and provide software solution recommendations
Ability to develop and communicate solutions to complex problems clearly and in nontechnical terms
Ability to manage multiple deadlines
Experience with data analysis tools (e.g., R, Python) preferred
Scientific background in chemistry, biology or related field preferred

A minimum of 2 years' experience in data management, data analysis, or related field

The Data Analyst will support the TRHC’s medication risk stratification process. Activities include but are not limited to data collection, data cleaning and preparation, manipulation with large data sets, processing the medication risk stratification using webservice and generating the report. The candidate will be also involved in managing and prioritizing requests for risk stratifications and running program code. This person will work in collaboration with TRHC’s Sale & Marketing department as well as scientists in the TRHC Scientific Precision Pharmacotherapy Research & Development Institute (SPPRDI) to carry out quantitative analyses and participate in collaborative research projects. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a high-impact clinical pharmacology team and collaborative setting.
TRHC SPPRDI is committed to the development of proprietary products, their validation and recognition by the scientific and regulatory communities to optimize medication regimen in order to improve patient outcomes, reduce utilization of various healthcare services, lower healthcare costs, and manage risk.
Primary Functions:
Point of contact for managing the medication risk stratification
Provides data analyst support, compiles and generates report for operations and business objectives associated with the TRHC medication risk stratification process.
Prepares and cleans data from customers prior to analysis; assembles, manages and analyzes large dataset.
Collaborates and manages risk stratification requests following developed operation procedures.
Identifies and searches missing NCDs.
Identifies data quality issues or errors and verifies the results.
Works with interdisciplinary teams of the R&D institute including research data analysts and clinical scientists, software engineer.
Maintains confidentiality and security with regard to data access.
Complies with all applicable regulations, maintains proper records in accordance with SOPs and policies.
Education and Experience:
Bachelors degree in computer science, applied math, economics, engineering, epidemiology or related public health field or related experience
At least 2 years of experience in a relevant discipline.
Health care related experience.
Experience using one or more of the following: SQL, SAS, MATLAB or Python.
Specific Skills:
Adept in basic data analysis using R, or proficient in other programming languages such as Javascript.
Understanding of general research objectives and overall research procedures.
Familiarity with research databases, data management of large databases including, but not limited to: Medicare databases from the CMS, insurance claims databases from private insurance companies, public use data files.
Ability to execute assigned project tasks within established schedule.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Applicant should be organized, self-motivated and capable of working autonomously as well as in a collaborative environment.

1. Customer First * We always think about how our decisions will impact our clients; earning and keeping customer trust is our top priority

Job Title: Data Analyst Supporting the FBI Laboratory
Description:
Be a part of the nationwide law enforcement initiative that removes the tools of crime from criminal organizations, depriving wrongdoers of proceeds from their crime and impacting the infrastructure of criminal enterprises.

Focused on delivering unsurpassed services in support of law enforcement and homeland security, FSA, a rapidly growing joint venture owned by trusted solutions providers SAIC and Amentum, has a vacancy for a Data Analyst. In this role, you will be supporting the overall mission of the FBI.

The Data Analyst position will assist the DNA Casework Unit (DCU) in its day-to-day operations by providing the management of

casework evidence and casework files. The job duties will be performed in a laboratory setting with the Case Administration Group

(CAG). This support will include the duties listed in the Job Description.

A Data Analyst executes the following duties:
Receive, inventory, and return all evidence received by the Unit
Maintain chain of custody on evidence
Perform routine laboratory maintenance
Provide organization and management of case files
Review data (completeness of information, proper execution)
Extract data from data base
Obtain additional information from other investigative agencies/data base
Establish/maintain physical file
Prepare notices/advertisements
Receive, suspense petitions, claims, process sharing requests
Reconcile inconsistencies
Prepare declarations
Gather information and organize investigative package
Verify case files and case tracking system
Maintain internal status information on the disposition of all forfeited assets
Assure information is accurate and perform analytical computations necessary to process data
Conduct and reconcile inventories
Distribute and receive documents
Assist lead analyst or official in obtaining/collecting all documents/information to complete case file
Provide administrative information and assistance concerning case to other investigative agencies, local law enforcement
agencies, US Attorney, and other DOJ processing units, and higher headquarters
Extract data from agency data base for management and program reports
Perform word processing relevant to case documentation
Perform data entry relevant to case
NOTE: Applicants with an Active Top Secret Clearance Preferred

Requirements

High School diploma or GED, Undergraduate degree preferred
Ability to grasp and understand the organization and functions of the customer
Meticulous data entry skills
Excellent communication skills; oral and written
Competence to review, interpret, and evaluate complex legal and non-legal documents
Attention to detail and the ability to read and follow directions is extremely important
Strong organizational and prioritization skills
Experience with the Microsoft Office suite of applications (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) and other common software applications, to include databases, intermediate skills preferred
Proven commitment and competence to provide excellent customer service; positive and flexible
Ability to work in a team environment and maintain a professional disposition
This position requires U.S. Citizenship and a 7 (or 10) year minimum background investigation

Agency Overview

Created in 1932, the FBI Laboratory is today one of the largest and most comprehensive crime labs in the world. Operating out of a state-of-the-art facility in Quantico, Virginia, the Lab's scientific experts and special agents travel the world on assignment, using science and technology to protect the nation and support law enforcement, intelligence, military, and forensic science partners

The Data Integration Analyst is a critical role at Forward Health Group that requires a broad spectrum of talents and responsibilities that are both internally and in some instances, client facing. The Data Integration Analyst is a member of the IT team and is responsible to obtain, analyze, transform and load data from client file extracts into the FHG client databases. Job duties include improving and normalizing data through scrubbing data, writing testing scripts, performing quality control on data and data storage, and enabling data access. This role also performs some database administration functions including ensuring the integrity and completeness of our core RDS MySQL databases in both production and back-up states to meet our business and customer commitments. This role is also responsible for a variety of system administration roles and serves as the subject matter expert with clients around data integration and access as necessary within the FHG database environment and is passionate about data integrity, is tenacious in resolving problems and possesses excellent attention to detail. This role assesses and escalates issues or risks to leadership as appropriate and serves as the point person for any database operations issues or data access questions on behalf of FHG.
Desired Skills:
Bachelors Degree in computer science, information systems, database administration or other related technical area or equivalent experience with the expectation that a Bachelors degree will be obtained within a reasonable timeframe following hire.
3 to 5 years prior experience working in IT in database management or systems administration with a heavy emphasis on data management tools and techniques including change management, systems administration, data management and access control related activities.
Strong SQL skills, including the ability to write efficient queries and read stored procedures
Solid understanding of data systems, including data relationships and data modeling with the ability to learn and understand various data environments
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts is beneficial (ETL, staging, data marts, etc.)
Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills.
Effective written and oral communication skills
Knowledge of relevant laws including the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) and IT security regulations (SOC 2 Type II) preferred.
SSIS or another ETL software experience preferred
Send cover letter and resume to:
hr@forwardhealthgroup.com

Job Title: Cell Therapies - Business Analyst, Data Integration
Description:
By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that I agree with Takeda’s Privacy Notice, Privacy Policy and Terms of Use.
Job Description
Are you looking for a patient-focused, innovation-driven company that will inspire you and empower you to shine? Join us as a Cell Therapies - Business Analyst, Data Integration in our Cambridge, MA office.
At Takeda, we are transforming the pharmaceutical industry through our R&D-driven market leadership and being a values-led company. To do this, we empower our people to realize their potential through life-changing work. Certified as a Global Top Employer, we offer stimulating careers, encourage innovation, and strive for excellence in everything we do. We foster an inclusive, collaborative workplace, in which our global teams are united by an unwavering commitment to deliver Better Health and a Brighter Futureto people around the world.
Here, you will be a vital contributor to our inspiring, bold mission.
POSITION OBJECTIVES:
As a Business Analyst within the Cell Therapy Data Integration team, you will be empowered to help integrate internal and external cross-functional data and be at the scientific forefront of Cell Therapies.
The main goal of this position is to assess an ever-changing data landscape within the Cell Therapies department. The successful candidate will have excellent organizational skills and a customer-oriented, diplomatic personality above all else.
You will be responsible for gathering data requirements of a wide array of groups in Cell Therapies; these range from Process Development, Analytical Development, GMP Manufacturing, Discovery, Clinical, Nonclinical/Preclinical and others. You will have the opportunity to learn what these varied groups do and how they create and ultimately submit their data into an internal data warehouse for integration; that information will be brought to the Data Integration team for assessment to create data mapping plans to transform the data into a standard structure for visualization.
You will also be responsible for tracking customers’ transfers of raw datasets, their expected frequencies of transfer, and communicating that information in a proactive fashion to the Data Integration Programmers. The successful candidate will also be responsible for tracking and communicating requests for datasets.
You will develop an expert understanding of Takeda internal electronic notebook data export; you will also evaluate new laboratory initiatives that may affect processes or generate new datatypes.
This new position will evolve over time as commonalities between datasets are noted and as standardization of data capture is implemented across the many data providers. The eventual goal of this position is towork smarter, not harder, by creating an automated system that transforms the data with little manual programming. The information provided by the successful candidate is an integral part of this effort.
POSITION ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Implement an organized tracking system to manage and track incoming raw data, outgoing processed data, and dataset requests
Meet with Cell Therapies teams to understand their data, their data’s structures, and gather requirements from their laboratories to help them capture and produce their data with cutting-edge efficiency
Work to establish Data Transfer Agreements with all parties with the goal of standardizing incoming raw data formats
Communicate the above findings seamlessly and effectively with the Data Integration Team
Maintain excellent relationships with all involved parties
Exist to Assist – this position exists to help others gain insight from their data. That is the most important focus of Data Integration in Cell Therapies.
EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS:
BS or MS in a scientific or other analytically focused field. For example: Biostatistics, Mathematics, Statistics, or Computer Science
0 + years (MS) or 3+ years (BS) of organizational experience and business analytics.
Evidence of project organizational skills and ability to organize multiple differing initiatives at the same time in a flexible, fast-moving environment.
Familiarity with the following is a plus: Clinical research, Clinical trial process and related regulatory requirements and terminology, understanding of Good Laboratory Practices (GLP) and Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP)
The candidate should have excellent written and verbal communication, organizational and interpersonal skills, be a strong team player and fully at ease in a matrix environment.
Self-motivation, innovative and critical thinking skills, and excellent time management are vital for success.
WHAT TAKEDA CAN OFFER YOU:
401(k) with company match and Annual Retirement Contribution Plan
Tuition reimbursement Company match of charitable contributions
Health & Wellness programs including onsite flu shots and health screenings
Generous time off for vacation and the option to purchase additional vacation days
Community Outreach Programs
Empowering Our People to Shine
Discover more at takedajobs.com
No Phone Calls or Recruiters Please.
