Company: New York City TAXI & LIMOUSINE COMMISSION
Description:
CANDIDATES MUST BE CURRENTLY SERVING IN THE COMPUTER AIDE TITLE TO APPLY.

The Prosecution Data Support unit is responsible for generating administrative violations and otherwise supporting prosecutors by providing relevant data and information.
Reporting to the Director of Prosecution Data Support unit, the selected candidate responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:

Prepare data reports as needed using Microsoft Excel
Create server data sets and re-usable queries using Microsoft SQL Management Studio and Oracle Developer.
Download and electronically distribute various documents from various electronic data sources.
Use an in-house web based CRM system for importing and tracking various violations.
Create violation templates and import files for the in-house CRM system.
Work closely with the IT department to troubleshoots technical issues for various environments.
Work with appropriate parties on legally acceptable language used in generated violations.
Contact licensees via phone and email to provide technical support for various electronic data submission streams.
Generating daily summonses for missed inspections or failed inspections at Woodside facility
Create one-off settlement offers for administrative violations, upon request
Updating various information in TAMIS system upon request
Downloading and analyzing NYS DMV abstracts or related database information
Suspending and unsuspending licensees’ TLC license upon request

Minimum Qual Requirements

1. A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent, and
(a) six months of full-time mainframe, mini-computer or LAN/WAN computer operations experience or service desk/desk top support experience acquired in the past one year and three months; or
(b) graduation from an approved technical school (approximately 675 hours) with a specialization in mainframe/mini-computer operations and/or technical support acquired in the past five years and three months; or (c) currently valid A+ or Network+ certification; or
2. An associate degree or 60 semester credits from an accredited college including or supplemented by 12 semester credits in computer technology; or
3. Education and/or experience that is equivalent to “1” or “2” above. Undergraduate credit may be substituted for experience on the basis of 30 semester credits, from an accredited college, including or supplemented by six credits in computer technology for three months of experience. However, all candidates must have a high school diploma or its educational equivalent.

Experience which primarily involves performing computer data entry and/or using word processing, spread sheet and/or database applications as an end user is not acceptable towards meeting the education and experience requirements for this examination.

Preferred Skills

An Associate's degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems or an equivalent degree.
Two or more years of relevant paid work experience with computerized data.
Working knowledge of Microsoft Excel.
Familiarity with Microsoft Access or Microsoft SQL Management Studio preferred.
Self-motivated, quick and assertive.
Uses different forms of communication in order to get the correct message across.
Uses different forms of data analysis.
Work with people, develop and maintain work relationships, communicate and manage conflict.
Ability to prioritize.
Ability to aggregate notes and data.
Ability to work in a team as well as independently

To Apply

Click, "APPLY NOW" Current city employees must apply via Employee Self-Service (ESS)

Work Location

31-00 47 Ave, 3 FL, LIC NY

Residency Requirement

New York City residency is generally required within 90 days of appointment. However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies to you, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview.

We’re looking for a Financial Services Data Analyst to join our team. This role requires experience creating ETL processes, troubleshooting data issues and creating ad-hoc reports.
This role will join the FAST (Financial Application and Systems Team) team which is built to support and extend the data capabilities of the organization as well as support the loan accounting and financial data systems.
Key to success in this position are the abilities to define and develop blueprints of data structures and their associations within a database, analyze ETL processes surrounding a given data system, understand and articulate the intent of any data transformations and verify that key lineages are identified and accessible in data lineage tooling.
The right individual should demonstrate exceptional data analysis skills, driven by a strong attention to detail and the ability to operate successfully in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Lead data analysis, data validation and data integration for financial applications and systems.
Collaborate with teammates on data integration using data integration methods, data governance processes, and best practices. Serve as a technical data owner for various financial data systems.
Provide expertise regarding the extraction, transformation and loading of data.
Respond to assigned systems issues and problems, determines cause and resolution, and communicates information to teammates, business owners, and leadership.
Assist in the development, generation, and distribution of data driven reports and ad hoc reports to meet operational business needs.
Coordinates financial system data requirements with vendors and works to ensure systems are implemented, configured and customized appropriately to meet business requirements.
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in an analytical field (e.g. math, economics, engineering, statistics, computer science, MIS)
Preferred Qualifications
Proficient in current and recent versions of Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle SQL Developer, Microsoft Visual Studio, and database optimization and monitoring tools.
High proficiency with database analysis, query analysis, optimization, tools and methods to automate the extraction, transformation and loading of data.
Who is Farm Credit Services of America
Farm Credit Services of America (FCSAmerica) is a great place to work. You see it in our people and the relationships they have with each other and our customers. Our passion and commitment to serving both rural America and each other is key to our success in the marketplace.
FCSAmerica is a leading provider of credit and crop insurance to farmers and ranchers in Iowa, Nebraska, South Dakota and Wyoming. It takes a lot of expertise to meet the needs of today’s agricultural industry, and our 1,700 employees provide that in areas of lending, risk management, technology, marketing, customer and employee education.
We are headquartered in Omaha, Nebraska, and support our customers and their rural communities from 43 local offices across our four-state territory. We take pride in serving every aspect of agriculture, from the young and beginning producer to some of the nation’s largest and most complex agribusinesses. The satisfaction that comes with serving an industry vital to all our lives shows in teammate surveys. FCSAmerica regularly is voted a top place to work.

Job Title: Sr. Data Analyst And Insights Manager (6388373)
Description:
No H1B or OPT candidates please
Do you love diving into data sets? Would you enjoy telling stories and helping others see the benefit of data based decision-making? As a Senior Data Analytics Manager at P&G, you are a Business Leader: you should be an effective communicator, ambitious, and able to drive insights into actions that improve P&G's business results. You'll need to mine multiple sources of data, derive actionable insights, and translate complex results or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to take action to win with consumers.
You will be a primary driver of delivering insights that will educate and influence key business decision-making with our Customer and Brand teams. Business knowledge, social, and communication skills are therefore needed to thrive in this multi-functional leadership team. We would like you to lead and improve analytical programs and results of your business unit / category / region together with consumer research.
Deliver analytic insights in several business domains including consumer, customer, digital, market & share performance. With a combination of analytical expertise, data and system knowledge and business insight, you'll answer and anticipate critical business questions and opportunities and deliver critical insights to the business in ways that make significant impacts.
Build analytic capabilities to grow organizations knowledge.
Develop in-depth business, analytical and systems knowledge to improve or build analytical solutions, approaches and business recommendations.
Demonstrating data visualization (Power BI, Tableau, Excel), and analytic tools (R, SAS, JMP, Python, Spark) to grasp the business insights from our mountain of data is what you will experience.
Collaboration with multi-functional teams (Consumer Research, Finance, Marketing, IT, Sales)
We believe you are an excellent fit, if you have:
A Bachelor or Masters Degree in a quantitative field (Operation Research, Computer Science, Engineering, Applied Math, Economics, Statistics, Analytics etc...)
Experience conducting quantitative and qualitative analysis with analytics techniques to solve defined business problems.
Ability to communicate and influence agreement to your recommendations
Experience telling stories and selling with data and insights.
You are comfortable working with diverse business scenarios, handling multiple priorities and have a business & consultancy mind-set, while technically (data) savvy.
Passion about discovering new things and ability to learn quickly.
We would also love to find someone who has:
Good social skills, self-motivated, dynamic, reciprocal and "can-do" attitude
Related full-time or internship experience with FMCG, Media, Ecom industry analytics
Data management and visualization skills / tools (SQL, KNIME, Spotfire, PowerBI or similar) is an advantage
Programming languages (Python, R, C# or Java) an advantage
4 years of related experience

Confidence can sometimes hold us back from applying for a job. But we'll let you in on a secret: there's no such thing as a 'perfect' candidate. HubSpot is a place where everyone can grow. About HubSpot

HubSpot helps millions of organizations grow better, and we'd love to grow better with you. Our business builds the software and systems that power the world's small to medium-sized businesses. Our company culture builds connections, careers, and employee growth. How? By creating a workplace that values flexibility, autonomy, and transparency. If that sounds like something you'd like to be part of, we'd love to hear from you.

You can find out more about our company culture in the HubSpot Culture Code ( http://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/34234/The-HubSpot-Culture-Code-Creating-a-Company-We-Love.aspx ), which has more than 4M views, and learn about our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace ( https://www.hubspot.com/jobs/diversity-inclusion ), too. Thanks to the work of every HubSpotter globally who has helped build our remarkable culture, HubSpot has been named a top workplace by Glassdoor, Fortune, Entrepreneur, and more.

HubSpot was founded in 2006. We're headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, and we have offices in Dublin (Ireland), Sydney (Australia), New Hampshire, Singapore, Tokyo (Japan), Berlin (Germany), Bogotá (Colombia) and Paris (France).

PDI is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team working in an exciting, high-volume retail data ecosystem with over $100 billion of transaction log data. This position plays a critical role at SwiftIQ and for both the retailer and their vendor partners to realize the most value from the data. Leveraging this rich dataset to help uncover insights to drive business decisions in the areas of promotion effectiveness, assortment and distribution opportunities, and understanding shopper behavior changes.
The candidate will be able to leverage their analytical skills coupled with relationship development and management and will need to apply those practices daily. Mastering the relationship between client data and the SwiftIQ platform will be an important element for this position. The successful applicant will be joining an open and diverse team with a can-do attitude, and a strong desire to make an impact in a start-up organization.

RESPONSIBILITIES & TASKS
The overarching responsibilities for this role are (i) own the relationship with various customers and be their go-to SwiftIQ contact, (ii) understand and analyze clients' data to provide valuable insights, and (iii) on-board new clients successfully and efficiently, including training on the SwiftIQ platform.
Serve as lead Business Intelligence Analyst for a portfolio of retailer & Consumer Packaged Goods clients.
Help clients best utilize the SwiftIQ platform to answer key business questions.
Drive adoption and usage of the platform through client trainings, ongoing engagement with multiple contacts within an organization, effective communication and relationship building.
Develop an expertise on each clients' individual business needs and identify ways to create and deliver value-add analyses through the SwiftIQ platform and/or ad hoc projects.
Write SQL code to support ad-hoc requests or BI projects, as well as investigate explicit issues.
Create presentations delivering insights and actionable recommendations.
Oversee new client onboardings by working closely with both the client and the internal data operations and engineering teams.
Work with clients and with the help of internal teams to mitigate any potential concerns.
Using client feedback, work with the Product team to continuously develop and improve product offerings and the user experience.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree required in Computer Science or Data related field.
2-3 years of professional experience in an analytical and/or client-facing role, preferably in retail or CPG industry.
Proven superb written and oral communication skills.
Outstanding analytical skills and a passion for problem solving.
Advanced in SQL, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Phenomenal organizational skills and one who naturally thrives in a multi-tasking environment with the ability to effectively manage priorities with limited oversight.
Experience with customer relationship management is a plus.
High emotional intelligence and interpersonal skills
Strong team player with an opportunistic and self-starting mindset

ABOUT THIS POSITION
The data analytics intern will be expected to use data analysis and statistical skills to help the Union identify business opportunities. Projects will focus primarily on analyzing customer data and ticket sales. This position will be expected to complete 2-3 medium to large scale projects over the summer with an emphasis on generating revenue and developing models that the organization can use moving forward.

Internships with Philadelphia Union will provide qualified interns with an assortment of valuable learning experiences and exposure to all facets of a professional soccer team’s front office. Interns will be asked to work nights and weekends.

POTENTIAL PROJECTS (could include but not limited to any of the following):
Dynamic Pricing Model
Which factors influence a given match’s demand for tickets?
Pertinent factors could include inventory, weather, secondary market sales, sales velocity, team performance, opponent, day of the week, leverage of the game, seasonal outcome uncertainty, schedule packing (games past 7/10/14 days), primetime packing, and any other factors the candidate feels would impact demand for match tickets.
This model will help determine dynamic single game pricing throughout the season.
Data Mining
Which factors influence a customer to buy a ticket?
Find factors that most strongly correlate with a propensity to buy the following categories of tickets:
Single match
Season tickets
Group tickets
The goal of this project is to build targeted niche audiences that have a higher propensity of converting.
Rate Card Assessment
Help the Corporate Partnerships team build a data-driven rate card.
Determine the Union’s most valuable sponsorship assets and help determine the appropriate price points for them using past deals, market research, and other factors.
Find undervalued assets to help the team bolster revenue from existing deals.
Find new assets to sell as part of sponsorship deals.
Reporting Improvements
Learn about and engage with the different reports generated and/or used by the Data Analytics team.
Assist with report automation. We are working to remove as many manual steps from the reporting process as possible.
Additionally, propose improvements to the reports’ efficiency, design, and ability to tell a story.

QUALIFICATIONS
Background in statistics, quantitative analysis, or other pertinent areas
Microsoft Excel
Experience with SAS, Tableau, or other analytics software
Ability to translate complex analysis projects into easily understood reports or summaries
Ability to work nights and/or weekends

*This is an unpaid, academic internship. To be considered, you must be receiving academic credit*

The Locale: Grand Prairie is part of the “Mid-Cities” region in the Dallas-Fort Worth Metroplex which is in the North Central region of Texas. Grand Prairie is a suburb of both Dallas and Fort Worth. The region offers a great cost of living combined with a robust economy and a pleasant climate. This North Central region of Texas is a great place to live and to raise a family. The region is home to numerous colleges and universities to include University of Texas at Dallas, University of Texas at Arlington, University of North Texas, Southern Methodist University, and Texas Woman's University. The Mid-Cities is the suburban region filling the thirty-mile span between Dallas and Fort Worth. These communities include the cities of Arlington, Irving, Grand Prairie, Grapevine, Southlake, Colleyville, HEB (Hurst, Euless and Bedford), NRH (North Richland Hills and Richland Hills), Haltom City, Watauga, and Keller, along with multiple other smaller towns such as Trophy Club and Roanoke and together represent more people than either Dallas or Fort Worth.

What you’ll be doing as a Data Analyst:
A data analyst at Orolia combines a high degree of technical ability with a strong understanding of cross functional business requirements. You’ll be leading efforts to standardize, improve and implement enterprise data processes, accomplished by understanding available data, designing processes to integrate various data sources and executing the integration. The Data Analyst will be an expert in possessing a high level of skill in data querying and will be responsible for designing, developing and managing data structures including databases and data warehouse. The Data Analyst will also use the available data to generate data visualization to assist key business users in decisions making processes.

Responsibilities will include:
Design, develop and manage data structures including databases and the data warehouse
Create visualizations of data to meet business needs
Lead efforts to standardize, improve, and implement enterprise data processing
Define standards for data handling including database design standards, data cleansing, validation and error handling
Mange and support middleware application(s) for transforming data
Script data integrations
Gather and confirm user requirements for various projects
Accurately process financial and operational data to create valuable business information

Proficient in analyzing data via SQL
Ability to create and refine stored procedures
Strong ability to create standard design documentation such as data flow diagrams and data dictionaries
Strong critical thinking skills and attention to detail to conduct a thorough analysis of data
Ability to effectively communicate technical solutions to both technical and non-technical individuals
Ability to methodically solve problems, with an aptitude for learning and quickly adopting new skills
Strong customer service orientation with a desire to act as a resource and help others
Ability to collaborate globally
Ability to have fun!

MS or BS degree in Data Science or relevant degree
2-5 years of proven experience in data analysis and reporting

Why Orolia?
Orolia is an international high-tech company dedicated to improving the safety, compliance and efficiency of its global customers’ remote operations by providing them business solutions and services based on the most advanced positioning, navigation, timing, sensing, information, and communications technologies. At Orolia, we continuously look to go “Beyond the Frontier” in everything that we do. As an organization, we strive to be the market leader and look for employees who have the same passion for their personal careers. If you love working in a multicultural environment where being the best is encouraged, Orolia is the employer for you.
Orolia believes that success in the global marketplace requires a variety of perspectives and individual experiences. At Orolia, we understand, appreciate and strive for new and different thoughts and ideas. A high degree of employee involvement, lifelong learning and diversity are permanent items on the agenda throughout the entire organization.

SUMMARY
At Lockton Affinity, information technology is seen as a major contributor to delivering exceptional business results. The data analyst position is a key contributor within the organization and has the opportunity to directly support our business vision. Lockton desires Associates who want to be part of something bigger than themselves, who possess a positive attitude and who are tenacious about overcoming obstacles encountered.

This position requires someone whose mind and skills are strong, and someone with a commitment to continuous learning and experimentation to keep them that way. This role also requires the ability to communicate and collaborate clearly with internal departments as well as with consultants and third-party contributors from outside the company.

We are looking for a Data Analyst who will facilitate the implementation of our data access strategy and our reporting and business intelligence initiatives to deliver timely relevant information to stakeholders throughout the Lockton Affinity organization and partner network. The ideal candidate will be enthusiastic, motivated, results-driven, flexible, detail-oriented, collaborative and adaptable. This position will work with subject matter experts, technical team peers, key stakeholders at all levels, and clients to deliver business value through the applied analysis of business data. This individual will operate within a culture of Autonomy and Purpose, with a high degree of accountability and is responsible for delivering thorough, high quality, completed work on time with high visibility throughout the organization.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITES
Develops and maintains reports for stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
Determines best practices and develops actionable insights and recommendations for the current business operations or issues.
Collaborates with various function teams such as marketing, research, underwriting, operations and IT to identify analytical requirements and achieve business results.

Uses commercial tools or develops custom solutions to generate metrics to present actionable recommendations.
Ensures data accuracy. Troubleshoots and improves performance of data applications
Maintains data integrity and data processing efficiency by working to eliminate redundancy and applying best practice data stewardship techniques.
May recommend data reporting or access tools and train end-users in their use.
Stays informed of the ways the organization uses its data.
Continuously learning and staying abreast of technology advances, specifically cloud data technologies.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Required
Introductory Data Analysis experience and demonstrated aptitude.
Demonstrated ability to work in an iterative (agile), fast-paced environment
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Advanced Excel proficiency to include Pivot Tables
Introductory SQL competency, basic Queries

Highly Desirable

ABOUT THE TEAM AND ROLE
-----------------------

theSkimm's Data & Analytics team provides robust measurement and actionable insights on our growing membership base. We partner closely with product, engineering, and marketing teams to build innovative products, understand customer demand signals, and measure growth and engagement.

As our company grows, we're looking for a Product Data Analyst to join our team. WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING
--------------------------

A/B testing strategy including design, execution, and analysis
Providing actionable insights to help product managers understand trends, marketplace dynamics, and user behaviors
Segmenting our Skimmr's to understand their different motivations and use cases along with our ability to fulfill those needs and add meaningful value
Conceptualizing key metrics to measure success and identifying levers to move key metrics
Building dashboards for all levels of the company, including executive leadership, to monitor key metrics and track progress
Identifying, collecting, and transforming data from disparate sources using SQL, R, Python, or other statistical tools
Developing a sound understanding of the role of each product within theSkimm's ecosystem of products
----------------------------
WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR
----------------------------

3+ years of experience in data analytics, consulting, or similar quantitative role
Understanding of A/B testing methodologies
Experience with large datasets, statistical analyses, data visualization
Strong communication skills
Strong SQL skills
Proficiency with business intelligence tools (e.g, Looker, Tableau)
Experience with Python or another scripting language
Understanding of user segmentation, cohort analyses, regression models, funnel optimization
Experience in Media or Publishing
Familiarity and enthusiasm for theSkimm: a passion for our audience and mission
-------------
WHAT WE OFFER
-------------

Comprehensive insurance plans, commuter benefits and 401(k) starting on your first day
Competitive salary & equity packages
Flexible vacation policy and generous holiday observances
One Medical Membership
Gym membership reimbursement
Catered Friday lunches and monthly gatherings
A vibrant office environment full of books, couches and a roof deck
Complimentary access to theSkimm's growing suite of membership products
The opportunity to be part of a values-driven, hardworking and diverse group of people building a membership company that makes it easier to live smarter
--------------
ABOUT THESKIMM
--------------

theSkimm is a membership company dedicated to helping female millennials live smarter lives. By seamlessly integrating into our members existing routines, we've become a trusted brand to more than seven million people. We're fundamentally changing the way our members consume news, consider products or services, and take action on important things happening in their lives. Our flagship product, the Daily Skimm, is still the fastest growing email newsletter on the market, and we've grown our product suite to fit into other routines at home, work, and on-the-go. theSkimm App debuted at #1 in News in iTunes, our podcast "Skimm'd from The Couch" reached #1 in Apple Podcasts within hours of launching, and more than 200,000 people voted with us in the 2018 midterm elections.

As theSkimm grows, we're committed to helping our members tackle big decision-making moments in life by giving them the information they need to make informed and empowered choices whether that be in civic engagement, finance, career, health, and more. Founded in 2012 by two friends on a couch, we've since grown to over 100 employees based in NYC. We are passionate. We are a TEAM. We work hard, but we know when to take a break to enjoy each other's company. Our products help people live smarter lives and we're building a brand trusted by millions of female millennials across the country. Join us!

DRT Strategies delivers expert management consulting and information technology (IT) solutions to large federal agencies, the U.S. Navy, state and local government and commercial clients in health care, technology, and the financial services industries.
The three letters of our name, DRT, stand for Driving Resolutions Together, which is the core philosophy on which the company was founded. That is, we collaborate with our clients to solve their most pressing IT challenges - together.
We are problem solvers dedicated to your success, combining Fortune 500 experience with small business responsiveness. Modern Health-
**************

Modern Health is a mental health benefits platform for employers. We are the first solution to cover the full spectrum of mental well-being needs through both evidence-based technology and professional support from a certified coach or therapist. Whether someone wants to proactively manage stress or treat depression, Modern Health guides people to the right care at the right time. We empower companies to help all of their employees be the best version of themselves, and believe in meeting people wherever they are in their mental health journey.

We are a female-founded company, backed by investors like Kleiner Perkins, Founders Fund, John Doerr, and Y Combinator, and partner with companies like Pixar, Gusto, Okta, EA, and Nextdoor that are taking a proactive approach to mental health care for their employees. Modern Health has raised more than $42 million and is looking for driven, creative, and passionate individuals to join in our mission.

An inclusive and diverse culture are key components of mental well-being in the workplace, and that starts with how we build our own team. If you're excited about this role, we'd love to hear from you!

*********
The Role-
*********

As a Product Analyst at Modern Health, you'll be integral to ensuring we have a culture of continuous improvement and are making informed product decisions to drive the best experience and outcomes for our customers.

*********************
What You'll Do-
*********************

Define appropriate measures of success for the Modern Health product in partnership with stakeholders across the company.
Partner closely with product teams to create and assess data-informed product roadmaps by exploring and analyzing product/usage data.
Conduct deep-dive data analyses using your skills in SQL query writing, data synthesis, and data analysis and translate the results into actionable business recommendations.
Help teams objectively quantify the impact of their work/projects.
Create dashboards that empower teams across Modern Health to dig into the product and operational data that matters most to them to make informed decisions.
Build tools, processes, and documentation to enable anybody across the company to make basic dashboards that meet their needs.
Answer strategic questions and do independent deep dives to help Modern Health better understand how our customers are using the product (and how they are not) and share notable insights across the company to shape roadmaps/plans/goals.
You will partner with stakeholders to evaluate the impact of the Modern Health product on the mental health and wellbeing of our users.
You'll own Looker (the BI tool we use) to ensure key dashboards are accurate, organized, and accessible to the organization.
************
Who You Are-
************

You have extensive experience with SQL, BI tools such as Looker, and data viz tools.
You are a self-starter and see projects through from inception to completion with minimal oversight.
You know how to explain complex topics and results in approachable terms so that people can take action on your recommendations.
You know how to marry data with qualitative research to paint a full picture of how a product is perceived and how it is being used.
You care deeply about product experience and quality.
You have experience working cross-functionally and partnering with stakeholders across departments of varying levels.

Stipend towards mental health benefits

Job description
We are seeking a Product Data Analyst to join our growing data team. You will work with our product, data, and engineering teams to measure and draw insights from our users on-site behavior. Your potential projects include tracking lead behavior to provide insights to marketing, and customer behavior within our educational platform to help us improve our product. Your analyses will inform where on-site behavior data can enrich our understanding of business performance.

The ideal candidate will have significant experience in product analytics and measuring the success of various marketing strategies. You should be fluent in tools to measure on-site user behavior with tools such as Heap or Amplitude, BI tools like Tableau or Looker, and understand their underlying data structures to work with product and engineering to create new data views.
Responsibilities

Analyze data and support experimentation to evaluate the performance of our website and ultimately improve the lead and student experience. Create dashboards to communicate findings to stakeholders
Work with product and engineering to maintain Thinkful’s Heap integration; define and track on-site lead and student behavior to answer key business questions.
Be an expert in our marketing data, including channel spend and attribution data. Use on-site analytics to measure the impact of marketing campaigns
Identify areas to integrate on-site data with other business data (e.g., order history) and work with engineering to define ETL processes
Requirements
2-3 years of measuring and drawing insights from consumer engagement with an online application or platform
Proficiency with website analytics tools like Heap, Amplitude, or Adobe Analytics
Strength in SQL, R, Python for data analysis, modelling and visualization.
Experience performing time-series trend analysis, multivariate segmentation and A/B tests to guide strategy and operational decision-making.

Job Title: OptumRx Business Analyst (Strong MS Excel / Data)

Optum, a UnitedHealth Group company, is a dynamic health services and innovation company. PBM (Pharmacy Benefit Management) or healthcare background

As a Fortune 6 company with over 325,000 people all pulling in the same direction, we’re used to setting the pace for change. Take a running start and join us so you can achieve more while doing your life’s best work.SM

Job Description:
SUMMARY
The primary purpose of this job is to utilize system analysis techniques to create compliant SDLC (System Development Life Cycle) documentation to provide direct support for the analysis, design, and development of systems including applications, infrastructure and databases. Frequent independent judgments are essential. The incumbent is also required to perform all tasks in observance of Rite Aid’s brand and strategy and adhere to our core values and service attributes.
Experience / Requirements:
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
The associate is responsible for the functions below, in addition to other duties as assigned:

Utilize system analysis techniques to create compliant SDLC (System Development Life Cycle) documentation to provide direct support for the analysis, design, and development of systems including applications, infrastructure and databases.
Observe, analyze and translate business processes, business models, requests, and issues into system requirements and structured documentation.
Provide advanced ad-hoc analysis of data structures and business process modeling.
Participate on multiple cross functional teams, regarding IT initiatives and coordinate Project Team Stakeholders to help develop Business Requirements for system solutions.
Provide analytic support for the review of individual IS Projects by preparing reporting reflecting individual Project Health.
Provide analysis on specific SDLC metrics (i,e, projects by type, by area, by Director, by status, by phase, by dollars left to spend, by dollars spent, and other project portfolio metrics utilized to govern IT.)
Prepare reporting that reflects the current state of the IT Project Portfolio.
Education:
Education and/or Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in Arts/Sciences (BA/BS) Business Administration, Accounting or Information Systems required.
Business Analysis, Business Process Modeling, IS Operations, Project Management or IS required.
Or equivalent combination of education and experience

JOB SUMMARY AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Assesses the data development and collection needs of assigned clinical service/functional/operational departments.
Coordinates the collection of and/or abstracts clinical, operational and financial data elements from multiple sources. Ensures the accuracy and completeness of data. Analyzes information to identify trends and present recommendations for improvements, as appropriate. Develops and maintains databases.
Prepares or oversees preparation of recurring and special reports for management reflecting clinical/financial metrics for dashboards and activities, such as statistical reports for operational and performance improvement. Analyzes, develops and researches electronic alternatives for system reports/queries/downloads to evaluate data. Creates data visualization and on-going reports for program management.
POSITION REQUIREMENTS:
EDUCATION:
Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Health Information Management, or a related field requiring strong data management or statistical analysis; or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Coursework in Statistics and/or Statistical Process Control required. Preferred: Master's Degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Health Information Management, Epidemiology, Public Health or related field requiring strong data management and statistical analysis.
EXPERIENCE:
Experience related to the integrating of data, preferably clinical in nature, from disparate sources; and managing databases; creating queries. Preferred: Advanced analytical skills for design, data display, report preparation and problem resolution.

Overview

We're looking for an exceptional business-focused data analyst to drive better decision making across edX and for our partners.

This is an opportunity to create tremendous business value as we build a world-class data team. You will build reports and conduct analysis to enable cross-functional teams and influence decisions across the organization. Improving use of data is one of edX's top strategic priorities. Your work will have a major and highly visible impact on our mission of providing high quality education to everyone, everywhere.

Responsibilities

Develop, document, automate, and monitor metrics and reports. Design data models and write ETL scripts. Ensure accuracy and alignment with desired business objectives.
Provide data and analysis to support decisions across all departments and for end customers.
Identify, implement, and drive adoption of analytics-based solutions to business problems.
Influence decisions at all levels of the organization, including presenting findings to senior leadership.
Innovate new ways analysis of data can be used to support the organization and its mission.
Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative discipline.
At least 5 years of hands on experience analyzing real world data.
Ability to acquire and manipulate data programmatically, including strong SQL skills and experience with a scripting language such as Python/R.
Demonstrably strong business orientation and propensity toward action.
Ability to draw scientifically robust conclusions from data, and attention to detail.
Scrappiness, big picture thinking, and interest in solving fuzzy business problems.
Excellent communication skills and a desire to collaborate closely with others.
Nice to have

Graduate degree in a quantitative discipline, or an MBA with a strong quantitative bent.
Experience with BI tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI).
How you will grow

Be part of a highly talented, collaborative, and practical data team that is always teaching and learning from each other.
Collaborate cross functionally and with senior leadership on some of edX's highest visibility initiatives.
Focus your energy on business impact, honing your ability to use data to create quantifiable value for an organization.
Play a key role in transforming a company early in its analytical journey into a highly sophisticated data-driven organization.
Solve challenging technical problems involving large volumes of data using cutting-edge tools.
Dedicate your time at work to furthering an important social cause, and have a big impact on edX's sustainability
Applicants must be able to work out of our Cambridge, MA office. Sorry, Visa sponsorship is not available.

About Twitch
------------

Launched in 2011, Twitch is a global community that comes together each day to create multiplayer entertainment: unique, live, unpredictable experiences created by the interactions of millions. We brings the joy of co-op to everything, from casual gaming to world-class esports to anime marathons, music, and art streams. Twitch also hosts TwitchCon, where we bring everyone together to celebrate, learn, and grow their personal interests and passions. We're always live at Twitch. Stay up to date on all things Twitch on Linkedin ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/twitch-tv/ ), Twitter ( https://twitter.com/Twitch ) and on our Blog ( https://blog.twitch.tv/ ).

About the Position
------------------------

The Financial Planning and Analysis team partners with all departments at Twitch to guide financial decisions and provide insights. For this role, we are looking for an experienced Data/BI analyst who will oversee data instrumentation, dashboard/report building, metrics reviews, inform channel investments, guidance on success/failure metrics, cost/benefit and ad hoc analysis. You will also work with technical and non-technical staff members throughout the company, and your effort will have a direct impact on hundreds of partners at Twitch. You will report to the Senior Director of Revenue in San Francisco, CA.

Responsibilities
----------------

Promote data knowledge and insights: manage communications with your team members and other teams, collaborate with colleagues to complete data projects and ensure all parties can use the insights to further improve
Create relevant insights from data analysis covering viewer, creator, ad sales, commerce and content deals
Maintain a customer-centric focus: aim to be a domain and product expert through data, develop trust among your peers and partners, and ensure that your team has access to data to make decisions
Work with team members and mentors to distill the problem, adapt your tools to answer complicated questions, and identify the trade-offs between speed and quality of different approaches
Create analytical frameworks to measure team success: partner with teams to determine success metrics, create approaches to track the data and troubleshoot errors, measure and evaluate the data, then develop a common language for all colleagues to understand these Indicators
Operationalize data processes: provide the team with ad-hoc analysis, automated dashboards, and self-service reporting tools so that everyone gets a good sense of the state of the business
Requirements
------------------

4+ years of domain experience in a consumer internet business, or in a high-velocity, high-growth product or department.
Expert Analytics tools skills to tap into Twitch's data pipeline.
Experience using data to create insight and achieve our goals.
Fluency in data analysis and communication around data, including time series analysis, experimentation, data visualization, and defining Goal strategy for your business.
Strategic and analytical capabilities.
Bachelor's degree.
Bonus Points
------------

Product analytics experience with signup funnels, engagement metrics, and retention analysis.
Technical background and programming experience–especially R or Python.
Statistics knowledge and hypothesis testing experience.
Experience developing dashboards using Tableau. SQL proficiency
Passion about online communities, games, and Twitch.
Perks
-----

Medical, Dental, Vision & Disability Insurance, 401(k), Maternity & Parental Leave, Flexible PTO, Commuter Benefits, Amazon Employee Discount, Monthly Contribution & Discounts for Wellness Related Activities & Programs (e.g., gym memberships, off-site massages, etc.), Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner Served Daily, Free Snacks & Beverages

Job Description
ENERGY FOR WHAT’S AHEAD
Are you looking to make a difference in your career? We’re working on smarter grids, cleaner energy and tools to help people manage energy more efficiently.

About Transmission and Distribution

Southern California Edison’s (SCE's) Transmission and Distribution Organizational Unit (T & D) is responsible for planning, engineering, constructing, operating, and maintaining transmission and distribution facilities throughout the 50,000-square-mile territory. T&D is the steward of roughly $19 billion in assets that safely and reliably deliver electricity to 14 million residents via SCE’s 5 million customer accounts.

Position Overview

This position will be in the Technical Planning Design Contractor Hub within SCE’s Transmission and Distribution (T&D) Organizational Unit. The Technical Planning Analyst will support process improvement projects and oversee the design and maintenance of organization reporting tools, scorecards, and metrics.

Typical Responsibilities:
Import and export Planning Progress Reports (PPR) using customized Access database (PoleTracker).
Award poles in PoleTracker for design to internal/external design resources.
Process deteriorated pole work-orders to the Pole Project Management Group (PPM).
Update PoleTracker with dates when work-order packages are received from contractors.
Validate data in Poletracker from Planning Progress Report (PPR) to ensure it matches the work order packages received from planning resources.
Verify work-order information using Design Manager, SAP, SharePoint, and other database resources.
Review and respond to Joint Pole Organization (JPO), Return-to-Originator (RTOs), Preliminary status reports (PREs), and Planner Memos.
Utilize primary and secondary data sources for tracking, reporting, and performance measurement.
Develop and generate internal/external reports for performance and scorecard data.
Develop ad-hoc reporting as needed.
Work with internal clients and design contractors to address scope, process, and billing issues.
Develop process manuals, job-aids, and flow charts.
Utilize SAS Visual Analytics for data extraction and reporting
Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications
Two or more years of experience as a program or project support analyst performing complex data analyses.
Experience utilizing advance functions of Microsoft Excel such as Sum-Ifs, V-Lookups, Index/Match, Pivot Tables, Macros, and manage and analyze large datasets.
Experience using SAS Visual Analytics for data extraction and reporting.
Desired Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Business, Information Technology, Business Analytics, or other related field.
Experience with Pole Tracker, Project Tracker, Design Manager (DM), SAP, SAS VA (or other visual analytics software).
Must be highly proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, Access, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
Experience providing high level analytics, including statistical analysis and use of visual analytics, to understand areas of improvement.
Experience working with construction design work orders.
Experience giving presentations and using reporting metrics to provide recommendations to leadership.
Experience with SAP’s Ariba functionality and invoice/billing processes.
Must demonstrate ability to stay current with relevant technology and innovation.
Comments
Candidates for this position must be legally authorized to work directly as employees for any employer in the United States without visa sponsorship.
Southern California Edison, an Edison International (NYSE:EIX) company, serves a population of approximately 15 million via 5 million customer accounts in a 50,000-square-mile service area within Central, Coastal and Southern California. Join the utility leader that is safely delivering reliable, affordable electricity to our customers for over 125 years.
